programme.title: Planet Earth III
programme.desc: Life in some of the many deserts and grasslands around the world, including in the baked Namib desert, where a pair of ostriches raise their family in the searing heat to keep them safe from predators. One troop of desert baboons are on a continual quest to find water and a young mother who is low in the pecking order must battle for her right to drink. Closer to the equator, in the grassland paradise of the Cerrado in Brazil, lives the rare, fruit-eating maned wolf, a bizarre creature about whom little is known

programme.title: The Heroic Quest of the Valiant Prince Ivandoe
programme.desc: So close to Eagle Mountain, Ivandoe And Bert get hopelessly trapped by an avalanche. Their thoughts turn to how they first met and started on their Quest.

programme.title: The Amazing World of Gumball
programme.desc: Gumball and Hotdog Kid discover why theyre so awkward with each other.

programme.title: The Wonderfully Weird World of Gumball
programme.desc: Gumball must help Principal Brown have body confidence about his butt in order to be allowed to do his poem about butts at the Poetry Recital. / Gumball must find a way to save his relationship with Darwin after the boys are forced to live in separate rooms. / Nicole befriends a sympathetic AI, but as their bond grows, it tries to isolate her from the rest of the Wattersons. / Gumball and Darwin seek healthy food for their family, but an evil food consortium controls the industry.

programme.title: The Wonderfully Weird World of Gumball

programme.desc: Prince Ivandoe and Bert set off on their heroic quest and, almost immediately, a winged serpent steals their map to Eagle Mountain. But that shant stop a plucky young buck and his devoted squire from fulfilling their destiny. With the assistance of a quite staggeringly incompetent Dwarf called Alan, a new sword is forged and the Quest continue-eth!

programme.title: The Heroic Quest of the Valiant Prince Ivandoe
programme.desc: A fire-breathing Giant Chicken is destroying the local farmers prize vegetables. Prince Ivandoe vows to capture the Giant Chicken, but... gets captured by her instead. He seems to bring out her maternal side, and she in turn reminds him of Nanny. So when an angry mob attacks, Ivandoe heroically jumps to his Giant Nanny-Chickens defence.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Pregnant Doc: During a chase, Specs accidentally swallows Lamput. The Docs plan to bring Lamput back to the lab! However, Specs gets misunderstood by bystanders as a pregnant mother in labor and gets dragged to a hospital against his will. While Specs gets used to being a mother-to-be, Skinny tries to get the two of them out of the hospital and back to the lab. programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Lamput has escaped yet again, and yet again, Specs and Skinny are in serious trouble with the Boss. He’s so fed up with their constant failure that he hires an out-of-towner: a super cool, hi-tech Doc who has all the moves and the attitude to match. The new guy’s hip to all of Lamput’s tricks, and before long, the shape shifting blob is safely back at the Lab. Specs and Skinny, robbed of their whole gig, end up on the streets, while Rival Doc gets all the glory. With glory comes blame, though, and when Lamput stages yet another signature crafty escape, the Boss turns all his fury on Rival Doc. Who hired this guy, anyway!? Lamput just wants things to be how they were. The orange blob helps the Docs get back their jobs at the Lab, Rival Doc is sent packing, and Lamput prepares yet another daring escape.

programme.title: Lamput

programme.desc: The nasty tennis player is big and angry and wants his ball back. The one Mr. Bean managed to throw on the roof of a house across the road.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean receives a delivery of a bunch of flowers for Mrs Wicket, but accidentally runs them over in the his car. He can’t afford to replace them, so he decides to recreate the bunch by taking flowers one by one from anywhere he can - a vase in a cafe, a wedding bouquet, even from between the teeth of a tango dancer! But will he assemble the bunch and be back in time for Mrs Wicket?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mrs. Wicket demands that Bean stay in to take delivery of a new lounge chair.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr. Bean is charged with keeping an eye on Irmas dog Mopsy, but Mopsy is a very wilful pooch! Who is really in charge of who?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean crashes his mini into a pool of slurry and is desperate to get himself and his car clean.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Specs and Lamput are accidentally taken onboard an alien spaceship! Before the aliens start experimenting on them, they have to find a way to escape. Thank goodness, Skinny and Boss come to the rescue but Specs and Lamput to figure out how to use an alien teleporter. Will they be able to do it before the aliens find them?

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Turns out constant, relentless failure can put a strain on a relationship. Specs and Skinny are no exception, and when yet another chase ends in embarrassment, misfortune, and physical injury, the Docs finally fall prey to “irreconcilable differences”. For a shapechanger, Lamput sure doesn’t like change; it’s like mum and dad are fighting. Lamput sets about trying to help the Docs patch things up. When conventional methods fail, our orange buddy is forced to subvert the very fundamentals of animated storytelling. Lamput’s perseverance finally pays off. The Docs have an epiphany: this blob trying to fix our friendship? Obviously that’s the real enemy.

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: Mr. Moustache is on a romantic date with Miss Lipstick during Loi Krathong festival (the famous annual Thailands light festival), an event that nothing must go wrong! However, the Docs and their chase with Lamput keeps getting in the way of the the lovers perfect night out.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders are hired to build a rollercoaster for Looneyburg. Bugs and Daffy soon get caught up trying to prove their part of the coaster is the best.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: Pro snowboarder Pepper Polar Bear hires The Looney Builders to build a ski resort. Pepper soon learns that others have different skill levels.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: The Batwheels take on a new vehicular villain who keeps growing bigger and bigger, while learning that size doesnt always win the day.

programme.title: Krypto Saves the Day!
programme.desc: Krypto embarks on a high-flying chase that creates major mayhem for a bus driver on his way to school.

programme.title: Krypto Saves the Day!
programme.desc: When a black cat crosses Krypto’s path, he’s determined to catch it before Halloween night is through.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang investigate the mystery of a frightening sorcerer who is haunting a snack factory, while Shaggy and Scooby discover their new favourite food.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang’s trip to be bayou is ruined by a shambling Swamp Beast that’s scaring away anyone who dares to enter it’s soggy domain!

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Irma is dragging a very bored Mr Bean around a shopping centre when he spots a competition for Minty Mints – pull your silliest face for a photo and win a cash prize! Mr Bean tries to queue but it’s too long - so he persuades Irma to visit a photo studio offering romantic photoshoots. Can Mr Bean get away with pulling funny faces and submit the photo to the Minty Mints people without Irma knowing?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: After seeing the flashy electric go-kart Mr Paliwal has bought for his daughter Divya, Mr Bean and Billy build their own using items around Mrs Wicket’s garden. At the go-kart track, Mr Bean and Mr Paliwal are unimpressed with Billy and Divya’s driving skills so take the karts for a “proper” race around the park. Meanwhile Mrs Wicket is on the warpath when she finds things missing from her house.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean embarks on plenty of adventures, along with his sidekick, Teddy. They try to stay out of the way of Mrs Wicket and her cat Scrapper, but often end up in trouble.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is at a farmers’ market with Irma at her knitwear stall – right next to a man selling novelty teapots. Bean is instantly smitten with a green car-shaped one but can’t afford it. When he visits a food truck that’s laid out free samples, he hatches a plan to swipe them and sell them on his own stall so he can raise the cash for the teapot of his dreams!

programme.title: Lamput
programme.desc: When Lamput masquerades as a swimming trophy at the local pool, Skinny finds himself in his red trunks, warming up for the big race. You’d be surprised at how fast a Doc can swim when there’s a Lamput up for grabs. Skinny discovers skills not even he was aware of. Shame the trophies keep switching places. No lap-time in the world can outsmart this little orange blob.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings find a crate of cell phones: there’s one for everyone. But before being able to play with their new toys, they need to charge the batteries. This operation uses all the electricity stored in the cabin’s solar battery and prevents Grizzy from watching TV. Grizzy soon realizes that this is the least of his worries, for living with the Lemmings and their phones is a guaranteed nonstop stream of noise pollution.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings discover a hidden mechanism on the Great Wall of China.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings find a strange card game.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings discover a very particular cocoa tree with chocolate-spread sap! Reduced to eating canned Brussels sprouts, the only remaining food in the cabin, Grizzy is baffled when he sees the Lemmings parading past to equip themselves with all sorts of containers: ladles, soup spoons, bowls, buckets, basins, etc. He watches them through binoculars and discovers that they have planted a faucet in a tree where chocolate spread flows. Grizzy decides to siphon off their tree.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings get a magical Mayan disc that transforms them into mutants

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy and the Lemmings fight for the last jar of Yummy with magic Mayan bracelets.

programme.title: SuperThings: Rivals of Kaboom - Kazoom Power
programme.desc: Kai and Finn must prevent the cinema’s destruction during a fight between Pop Shock and Bubbles, caused by poor-quality popcorn.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: The gang goes to Salem, Massachusetts, for the historical festival, only to discover history repeating itself as a demon has been set loose on the town, supposedly summoned by a witch as revenge for the infamous 17th-century Salem witch trials.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Fred and the gang are called in to help with a mystery involving a figure from Freds past, Professor Huh? Fred discovers Rose, with whom he learned mystery solving until they had a falling out, has also arrived with her gang.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Irma is dragging a very bored Mr Bean around a shopping centre when he spots a competition for Minty Mints – pull your silliest face for a photo and win a cash prize! Mr Bean tries to queue but it’s too long - so he persuades Irma to visit a photo studio offering romantic photoshoots. Can Mr Bean get away with pulling funny faces and submit the photo to the Minty Mints people without Irma knowing?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean needs to impress Irma who is infatuated with the hunky deliveryman. Bean tries to improve his physique at the gym but has little success. Instead he opts for an inflatable muscle suit. Irma is indeed impressed and Bean’s plan seems to be working – until the suit gets punctured and Bean makes the mistake of re-inflating it with helium. As Bean floats off into the sky will Irma’s admiration be punctured?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is initially charmed when a seemingly cute seagull turns up on his windowsill. Bean feeds the gull and invites the bird inside. But it’s not long before the seagull in the flat turns out to be a cuckoo in the nest taking over Bean’s home – eating all his food controlling the TV and sleeping in his bed. Bean starts to regret taking on a new best friend in place of good old reliable Teddy.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: After a regrettable episode involving his landlady sleepwalking into his room, Mr. Bean suddenly finds himself out on his ear with nowhere to live. Near to tears, he yearns for the cosy familiarity of his old home. A scarecrow and a pair of false teeth come to his rescue.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: A hungry hog reveals his snack-sniffing skills. Could he lead Grizzy and the Lemmings to more tasty surprises?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: In order to win a trophy filled with Yummy candies, Grizzy and the Lemmings take part in a safari photo competition on an animal reserve. They must capture the portraits of a number of wild animals that live in the park. It requires all their cunning to approach the elephant, wart hog and bat and take photos for the contest. But when it comes to the super-speedy, blue-necked ostrich, its a different kettle of fish!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: While Grizzy organizes a picnic alongside the pond, the Lemmings steal his jar of Yummy using water balls to discreetly advance underwater. Despite their equipment, the bear surprises the Lemmings and traps the rodents inside a waterproof ball which he throws far into the distance. An ostrich mistakes the ball for her egg and sits on it, waiting for the egg to hatch. The Lemmings are adopted by this new mother who is prepared to do anything to satisfy her offspring!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Chased by a raging elephant, Grizzy and the Lemmings are ejected from the cabin and land on a small nearby promontory. One of the rodents finds himself seated upon a throne-shaped boulder. A ray of sunlight illuminates him, and the savannah animals bow down before the Lemming king! But as soon as he leaves his royal seat, his powers disappear. Grizzy grabs the opportunity to plop down on the throne. Upon his orders, the other animals seek to provide him with every comfort, bringing the cabin, television and food closer. But the Lemmings put their feet down.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: The Lemmings create an irresistible rhythm on a set of magic drums and kick off a battle of the bands with Grizzy, who just wants a good nights sleep.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: In the midst of a heat wave, Grizzy and the Lemmings fight over the fridge. The rodents want to transform themselves into ice cubes to glide across their super curling ice slide, while Grizzy wishes merely to lie down inside the nice, cool appliance. After literally breaking the fridge in two, the Lemmings discover a container of refrigerant and create a new giant curling sheet in the savannah. But Grizzy has not given up the idea of resting in a cool spot!

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy has gone all out for his dinner guest, the she-bear. But just as he is about to kiss her… Vroom! In the middle of a mad car race, the Lemmings wake him up with a jolt!

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: A sneaky trick strands the Batwheels at the docks, clearing the way for a Batcave heist by the Legion of Zoom. It’s up to MOE to stop the Zoomers with zany improvised tricks and traps with a little help from Ace and Batcomputer.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: Penguins Ducky Boat becomes the fastest vehicle in Gotham.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: When Buff befriends Mr Freezes snowcrawler Snowy, the other Batwheels bristle at the thought of hanging out with a "bad guy" so Buff sets out to change their minds.

programme.title: Batwheels
programme.desc: After he causes the Batwing to crash, Bam becomes obsessed with making it up to her during a high-stakes aerial mission against Penguin and his giant ducky blimp.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders try to help Winston Whale by building him a mail truck, but Winston is used to working alone.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: When Mayor Foghorn Leghorn hires The Looney Builders to build a lighthouse for Looneyburg, Lola’s tablet breaks and she must rely on herself.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Looney Builders redesign the final hole of ACME Acres Mini Golf Course, and Porky is determined to get it just right for the kids.

programme.title: Bugs Bunny Builders
programme.desc: The Beaver Brothers hire The Looney Builders to build them a log cabin, but soon sidetrack the job by goofing around too much.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Feeling bad for giving Toms precious blanket to Badwill, Jerrys determined to get it back. Unfortunately, retrieving gifted items from Badwill is not easy.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom gets a can of Cat Cop a spray that creates a tiny cop.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Quacker, Tuffy and others in the Dandy Do-Gooders club earn their badges with the help of their club leader, Jerry, who creates new ways of irritating Tom.

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Trouble ensues when Tom is separated from his own shadow. Having been trapped with Tom its entire life, the shadow refuses to go back to the life it once had. But when the shadow becomes a total nuisance to Tom and Jerry, they team up to shed some light on the problem!

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: While Rick and Ginger are looking after their adorable niece for the weekend, Rick jokingly puts Spike in charge of keeping the kid safe while Ginger goes to the store. Taking his new job seriously, Spike swears that nothing will happen to the baby. Naturally, this is where Tom and Jerry arrive on the scene to wreak havoc and make Spikes babysitting job quite possibly be his last!

programme.title: The Tom and Jerry Show
programme.desc: Tom is stranded on a deserted island. The only other living inhabitant is Jerry. Let the survival of the fittest begin!

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella and Slippy are practicing Pluto Jump Ride when Tilly begs to go too. Ella tells her its too dangerous and gives her a practice jump stick before she leaves. Madhu arrives to play and finds Tilly alone.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: Ella, Slippy and Madhu are spiral space diving when Ella explains what inspired the idea. Its a huge colourful spiral that Maggie is not able to identify. As she tries, she begins to glitch.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: The Ryder family completes a drill in the event of a Starquake. Shields are deployed around Home and Dads museum on the moon. The drill is a success but the shield on the moon is stuck open.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: When Ella heads out to collect some space materials for the Clubhouse, she borrows Slippy’s luckiest good luck charm, Mooncake. But when Ella arrives at a black hole, Mooncake is bumped off her Moonscooter into the strong gravity of the black hole.

programme.title: Interstellar Ella
programme.desc: It’s Ella’s mom’s birthday! Determined to get her mom the bestest birthday gift ever, Ella searches the Galaxy with help from her friends. But with time running out, she’ll have to realize that the best gift of all may not come wrapped in a box...

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Chief is persuaded to take a day off and puts Tinker in charge of getting into Toad Hall. But Tinker has bigger plans than that!

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Hedge, Ratty, Mole and Toad go on a boat journey upriver to find the mysterious Song Stone.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Ratty boasts that he could take The Rats Nest out on a big adventure into the wide ocean, but when his friends encourage him to follow his dream, he reluctantly feels compelled to leave the riverbank.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Its spring, and Mole is whitewashing his burrow. His friends come to help while the watching weasels spy an opportunity to play a prank on them.

programme.title: Toad And Friends
programme.desc: Ratty takes his friends out for a boat trip and insists, as Captain, what he says goes. But when the boat is scuppered on the rocks, he finds that listening to his friends is the way to save the day.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Bean turns superhero in an attempt to outwit a cunning cat burglar.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean is tidying his flat and chucking out a load of old unwanted junk. Unfortunately during the big clear out Teddy accidentally falls into a bin bag which gets put out in the street. Bean is horrified when the rubbish van arrives and he realises that dear old Teddy is now on his way to the landfill. Bean races across town to the dump but how will he ever find his friend amongst all the mountains of junk?

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean buys a robot to clean his flat but it ends up trashing half the town.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: Mr Bean wants an ice cream from the ice cream van but ends up serving himself – along with every kid in town.

programme.title: Naked And Afraid Apocalypse
programme.desc: In a scorched wasteland, 12 battle-tested veterans scavenge the ruins to survive. A rogue elephant forces a camp to make shelter from junked cars.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike purchases a mouldy Porsche Boxster with seized brakes and a host of other faults, but at £1,000, he cant resist. Can Edd fix it up enough to turn a profit?

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard teams up with Turbo Pickers Paul Cowland to purchase a 1969 Mark 2 Jaguar and a 1970s Mercedes 350 SLC in hopes of fixing them up and making a nice profit.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys an old Range Rover Mk3 for a bargain price, hoping Edd China can renovate it and have it resprayed white in order to pass it on for double the amount he paid.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: The boys are challenged to find a Lotus Elan that hasnt been snapped up by restorers. Once theyve tracked one down, Mike falls in love after minutes behind the wheel.

programme.title: How Its Made
programme.desc: Find out how Chinese style furniture, electrical switches, Thai fish sauce, and cappers are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they weave a Turkish carpet? How do they use helicopter blade technology for cross country skis, and control the water at Niagara Falls?

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew haggles with a dealer at an Elizabethan manor house. He spots a jet engine in a Welsh museum, and meets an old friend in Sheffield - finding a modern treasure.

programme.title: The Great Antiques Challenge
programme.desc: The dealers compete to hunt down industrial salvage for a homeowners fireplace and mid-century furniture for a flooded bar.

programme.title: Farmhouse Fixer
programme.desc: An outdated farmhouse is transformed into a functional family home with an earthy design. Jon and Kristina create a kitchen fit for a chef, a traditional New England family room, and even a goat jungle gym for their new farm animals.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike is in France to hunt down the rare Renault Alpine 310. The car he finds is great, but it has some surprises in store, and Edd is charged with getting it fixed.

programme.title: Mighty Truckers
programme.desc: Being a truck driver isnt easy: long hours, huge loads and busy roads are just some of the issues they face. Truckers share their journeys.

programme.title: Mighty Truckers
programme.desc: Truckers from Germany, Italy and Holland share their journeys.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: At Barajas Airport, officers discover hidden compartments in two lamps. In Andalusia, the civil guard raids the homes of suspected drug traffickers.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: In Andalusia, a random inspection exposes a driver with an outstanding arrest warrant. At the Port of Barcelona, a driver hasnt declared his cargo.

programme.title: Naked And Afraid
programme.desc: Two superfans battle oppressive heat and relentless insect attacks in Guyanas scorching savanna. Severe dehydration forces a desperate fan to drink unsanitary fluids.

programme.title: Ant Anstead Master Mechanic
programme.desc: Ant has 12 weeks until his baby boy is due, and the same amount of time to fulfil a childhood fantasy, to own a 1950s Alfa Romeo 158.

programme.title: Ant Anstead Master Mechanic
programme.desc: Ant has found a donor 1950s chassis, so his ambitious Alfa 158 build can now begin in earnest. He also digs deep into his inspiration for this project.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they brew a beer that wont make you drunk? How do they build a car that flies over rocks and boulders? How do they make escalators? How do lie detectors work?

programme.title: How Its Made
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope as we discover how they are made, including levels, hot dogs, abrasive grains and sandpaper.

programme.title: Fast N Loud
programme.desc: Richard and the Monkeys partner up with SEMA Battle of the Builders finalist Big Mike to build Gas Monkeys first-ever import tuner, a 1975 Datsun 280Z.

programme.title: Gold Rush: Mine Rescue with Freddy And Juan
programme.desc: Freddy and Juan expose the truth behind the pitfalls of gold-hungry miners, sharing their book of mining tips and tricks to avoid expensive mistakes.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: In a last push, Reaper Nation fights to mine until the bitter end. Shawn reaches for gold in deeper waters. Emily depends on her last remaining diver.

programme.title: High Speed Chase
programme.desc: Officers track down a stolen military vehicle, face off with a sword-wielding fugitive claiming to be God, and pursue an armed carjacker.

programme.title: Moonshiners: Whiskey Business
programme.desc: Tim Smith and his team of experts help struggling distillery owners put the woods back in the whiskey in the hopes of turning it from problem to profit.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Woodworker Robin Johnson restores a huge kitchen dresser for dealer Karyn Sparks. Leather expert Martin Ashcroft works on a unique set of leather books.

programme.title: Brake Room
programme.desc: Twelve-time AMA Champion Ricky Carmichael and Moonshiner Tim Smith face off while viewing some of the biggest and baddest videos in the motor world.

programme.title: Brake Room
programme.desc: World Finals Monster Truck Champion, Adam Anderson, and Moonshiner Tim Smith compete to predict the outcome of the worlds craziest motor videos.

programme.title: Gold Rush: Mine Rescue with Freddy And Juan
programme.desc: Freddy and Juan expose the truth behind the pitfalls of gold-hungry miners, sharing their book of mining tips and tricks to avoid expensive mistakes.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: In a last push, Reaper Nation fights to mine until the bitter end. Shawn reaches for gold in deeper waters. Emily depends on her last remaining diver.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a 1966 Morris Minor Traveller for the bargain price of £2,400, and makes plans for Edd China to renovate it so he sell it on for at least £7,000

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: The boys are in Staffordshire on the trail of a Ford Capri. They find a beauty, but its got tatty bodywork and needs a new interior.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike purchases a mouldy Porsche Boxster with seized brakes and a host of other faults, but at £1,000, he cant resist. Can Edd fix it up enough to turn a profit?

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Who said three-wheeled cars cant be desirable? Mike goes on the hunt for a truly iconic car - the 1970s Bond Bug. Its orange, has no doors and only three wheels.

programme.title: How Its Made
programme.desc: Find out how race car oil, plaster mouldings, lemongrass oil, and fly tying vises are made.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How do they turn seaweed into sushi wrapping? How do they make a beer bottle that lasts for 15 years? And, how do they keep surfers safe from man-eating sharks?

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: In Tyne and Wear Drew tries to satisfy a customer with a taste for mid-century chic. Plus, he is enchanted by a former friary where a rare mirror catches his eye.

programme.title: The Great Antiques Challenge
programme.desc: The dealers compete to find a bakers table for a family kitchen. Plus, they search for Victorian industrial salvage for a restaurant owner.

programme.title: Farmhouse Fixer
programme.desc: Its a sugary sweet renovation when Jon Knight and his team tackle a bakers 1910 home. Together, Jon and Kristina Crestin give her a charming, retro kitchen that any baker would love and a luxurious main suite the single mom truly deserves.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike finds a 914 in a barn, but under the muck he can see a profit in the 70s sports car, so he buys it for a bargain price. Can Edd restore it to a saleable condition?

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike finds a 56-year-old Citroen 2CV, retired in the sunny south of France. However, with age comes problems - can Edd fire life into the smoky old engine?

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike buys a supercar from the super saver menu, specifically an Italian thoroughbred for under £10,000. But with supercars come super-sized bills.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike tracks down a part-finished restoration Camaro in California with its fair share of problems. Can the duo work their magic and make a profit on the project?

programme.title: Naked And Afraid
programme.desc: A recently married couple take on the perilous Philippine jungle. Their relationship is put to the test by relentless bugs, deadly boars and torrential rain.

programme.title: Ant Anstead Master Mechanic
programme.desc: Ant visits an Alfa specialist and gets more than he bargained for. Its win-win, but itll be tricky to fit a Spiders axle, gearbox and engine into his 158.

programme.title: Ant Anstead Master Mechanic
programme.desc: Ant is beginning to feel the pressure of his ambitious build. The only place he can get the correct body mould on short notice is more than 5,000 miles away.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how the axe was first forged. The programme also observes a messenger bag get cut, sew, stitched and glued together and reveals how the fastest lifeboats are built.

programme.title: How Its Made
programme.desc: More everyday items are put under the microscope as we discover how they are made, including ice cream treats, wooden golf clubs and aircraft wings.

programme.title: Fast N Loud
programme.desc: The Monkeys and Big Mike race to finish their 75 Datsun 280Z. But a missing part may stop Richard from debuting Gas Monkeys first-ever tuner car at SEMA.

programme.title: Mike Brewer: Born Dealer
programme.desc: Mike buys a stinker of a car at auction. Plus, a BMW M3 turns into a rotten headache and Mike tries to sell The Stig a nice little runaround.

programme.title: Twin Turbos
programme.desc: The DeBertis build a beastly rock-crawler on spec, hoping for a big payday to fund Brads racing career. Joey Logano coaches Brad before the biggest race of the season and Brads best chance at getting a sponsor.

programme.title: Fast N Loud
programme.desc: Richard and the Monkeys partner up with SEMA Battle of the Builders finalist Big Mike to build Gas Monkeys first-ever import tuner, a 1975 Datsun 280Z.

programme.title: Edge of Alaska
programme.desc: Neil is on the brink of reopening the Motherlode mine for tourism, but a new arrival puts Neils empire at risk. Jeremy begins a new venture to grow his family farm.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Dealer Drew Pritchard asks blacksmith Nev Morris to save a wirework plant stand thats ready for the skip. Metal worker Ted Edley restores a vintage pedal truck.

programme.title: Brake Room
programme.desc: Its a battle of beards and brains as host Nick Stevens pits top car dealer and podcaster Jeff Allen against The Humble Mechanic, Charles Sanville.

programme.title: Brake Room
programme.desc: Legendary comedian and skateboarder, Jason Wee Man Acuna and motoring podcaster Jeff Allen face-off while viewing the craziest videos in the motor world.

programme.desc: Mike buys a stinker of a car at auction. Plus, a BMW M3 turns into a rotten headache and Mike tries to sell The Stig a nice little runaround.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike tracks down a TVR Cerbera for just £8,000. However, these classic sports cars are susceptible to rust. Can Edd patch it up or will the chassis need replacing?

programme.title: How the Universe Works
programme.desc: Astronomers have discovered bizarre planets very different to Earth out in the galaxy, but will we ever locate a planet similar to our own?

programme.title: How the Universe Works
programme.desc: Neutron stars are violent phenomena that defy the laws of physics. New discoveries reveal they have the power to destroy planets and even other stars.

programme.title: How the Universe Works
programme.desc: Supernovas are the violent death of giant stars. New discoveries reveal how these events create the elements that are essential to all life in the universe.

programme.title: Truth Behind the Moon Landing
programme.desc: Confidential CIA files reveal a secret war for space between America and the Soviets. And, experts investigate American espionage during the Apollo programme.

programme.title: Truth Behind the Moon Landing
programme.desc: Experts investigate the Lunar Landing Research Vehicle that nearly killed Neil Armstrong during training. Some believe this proves why the moon landing is fake.

programme.desc: Geologists discover alien deposits on the Earths surface - and the answer could shed light on the cause of the greatest extinction in its history.

programme.title: Botched
programme.desc: Famed plastic surgeons Dr Terry Dubrow and Dr Paul Nassif do what they can to support clients who have suffered a range of plastic surgery disasters. In this third season, they meet people with all kinds of needs, from a woman whose nipples are too high to an ex-Playboy model who wants a second chance at fixing her nose and body. They also support an out of this world patient who wants to look like an alien, a woman who wants to like a pixie, and a reality star who wants the doctors to make her look "plastic fantastic". These are just some of the people that Terry and Paul come across as they try to remedy plastic surgeries that have gone wrong, but expect to see many more as they work with clients across the United States. Some cases are challenging and some are downright outrageous, but with their special brand of skills, the celebrated doctors at the heart of this American reality series work hard to restore both the looks and the self-confidence of their struggling patients.

programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: Follow the work of scientists looking for alternative Earths as they scan and map the universe.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Why do many cultures tell similar tales of monsters and giants? Could they be eye-witness accounts of extraterrestrials? Series examining evidence of aliens on Earth.

programme.title: The Best of MonsterQuest
programme.desc: Sightings of serpentine creatures lurking in dark waters around the globe have been documented for centuries. The MonsterQuest team investigates two legends in an attempt to uncover the truth of what lies below the surface.

programme.title: Brad Meltzers Lost History
programme.desc: In a special season finale, Brad Meltzer provides updates on how viewer tips are helping the search for lost and stolen historic artefacts.

programme.title: Lost Relics Of The Knights Templar
programme.desc: The series finale focuses on the reliquary casket. Carl and Hamilton know the casket dates to a later period - probably early 15th century. Yet a series of engravings on it - the box code - appears to make veiled references to Templar beliefs.

programme.title: Lost Gold Of World War II
programme.desc: American treasure hunter John Casey returns to the Philippines with a new team and new technology, in a continued effort to solve one of World War IIs greatest mysteries. A satellite scan of the mountain reveals massive metal deposits underground.

programme.title: MonsterQuest
programme.desc: Mariners have long told stories of beasts stalking the coasts of Florida, but what if new video could prove that old sailors were seeing real sea monsters? A forked tail, ferocious teeth and a large body were all characteristics of the sea monsters.

programme.title: Lost Worlds
programme.desc: From Stonehenge to the Orkney Islands, pagans built extraordinary structures. Can the latest archaeological research and a new understanding of pagan beliefs shed light on how?

programme.title: Lost Relics Of The Knights Templar
programme.desc: The series finale focuses on the reliquary casket. Carl and Hamilton know the casket dates to a later period - probably early 15th century. Yet a series of engravings on it - the box code - appears to make veiled references to Templar beliefs.

programme.title: Lost Gold Of World War II
programme.desc: With new evidence suggesting the location of a possible treasure vault beneath the waterfall, John is determined to find a way in, but mother nature is wreaking havoc on his plans. Meanwhile, a clue uncovered at Breach 6 has the team going all in.

programme.title: MonsterQuest
programme.desc: In the Pacific Northwest, a small island may hold the clue to unravelling the mystery of the legendary Sasquatch. Natives told tales to their children of an ape-like beast to be feared that would steal them should they venture into the forest.

programme.title: Lost Worlds
programme.desc: At the end of the 13th century, Scotland was a country under attack. Defeat seemed inevitable. But from nowhere emerged a man who became Scotlands greatest hero - William Wallace, commonly known as Braveheart.

programme.title: The Universe
programme.desc: Discover how the sun has both helpful and harmful effects for life on Earth.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Places on Earth where aliens may have landed in ancient times, from Mexicos Zone of Silence to the Markawasi Plateau in Peru.

programme.title: The Unxplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: Is it possible that the mind and body can use the power of ritual to tap into hidden forces that lie just beyond the grasp of conventional explanation?

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: In 2008, the UKs Ministry of Defence released decades worth of classified UFO files to the public. One month later, UFO hysteria ripped through the country.

programme.title: Where Did It Come From?
programme.desc: Many years before modern air travel, the ancient Chinese had learned and were practising the complicated principles of fluid and aerodynamics in the kites they flew, the boats they sailed and the children’s toys they made.

programme.title: River Hunters
programme.desc: Rick Edwards and Beau Ouimette look for evidence of Roman life in Scotland, heading to Ardoch Fort in Perthshire, on the east bank of the River Knaik. It spans over eight and a half acres and was built under Agricola around 80AD on the east bank of the River Knaik. The fort occupied a key strategic route through Perthshire and into north-east Scotland from the First to Third centuries.

programme.desc: Researcher Marc Seifer recruits astrophysicist Travis Taylor and investigative journalist Jason Stapleton to help unravel the mystery of inventor Nikola Teslas missing files, which were confiscated by the US government after he died in 1943.

programme.title: Pawn Stars

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When an early handheld video game system comes into play, can Corey make a deal before its game over? Plus, a seller brings Rick a tambourine once played by Prince. Will the negotiation have Rick partying like its 1999?

programme.title: Curse Of Skinwalker Ranch
programme.desc: As the team relaunches their investigation on Skinwalker Ranch, they are surrounded by a shocking phenomenon.

programme.desc: When a customer walks in with a "Tommy Boy" poster signed by Chris Farley, will it have Corey saying holy schnikes, or does it belong in a van down by the river?

programme.title: The Curse Of Oak Island
programme.desc: Spirits are high and the Fellowship is more hopeful than ever as the team digs into Aladdins cave.

programme.title: The UnXplained With William Shatner
programme.desc: There are ancient structures that defy explanation because even with todays technology they would be nearly impossible to duplicate. How were ancient civilisations able to build such extraordinary structures? And what purpose did they serve?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick and Chum kick it with a rare pair of Pumas from 1968. But will a shocking sticker price leave them in the dust, or can they race their way to a deal?

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chum chases down a lead on a 1963 Fiat Microcar. Next, Jake gets a lesson from big brother Corey when a rare musical instrument enters the shop. Finally, will Ricks prayers be answered when he examines the holy grail of coins?

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Beneath the sands of Egypt lie 24 enormous sarcophagi and every one of them is empty. What purpose might these giant tombs have served? And is it possible that the perfectly carved boxes were designed not by humans... but by otherworldly visitors?

programme.title: Kevin Costners The West
programme.desc: When Civil War veteran Col. Henry Carrington takes command of Fort Phil Kearny in Northern Wyoming, he never expects to face such a ferocious enemy as Red Clouds band of Lakota Sioux.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient Aliens is counting down ten of the most intriguing and mysterious symbols and codes found that just might contain proof of otherworldly contact. From glyphs in the Peruvian desert, to spiral petroglyphs embedded with advanced mathematics.

programme.title: The Unbelievable With Dan Aykroyd
programme.desc: Looking at outlandish inventions, including a full-body gas mask for babies, Smell-o-Vision, a robot powered by slugs, inflatable airplanes, hidden cameras in contact lenses and coffin security systems.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: When Rick takes a swing at a Honus Wagner baseball card, will it be the real deal? Chum strums a custom Fender by popular guitar maker John Carruthers. Can he pick the right price, or will he end up fretting?

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Messy borrows Zoes umbrella and it gets swept away by the rain. Messy and his friends go on a white water adventure down the drain in search for it!

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: A blockage somewhere in the sparkleberry juice system that powers Berry Bitty City results in a repair crew of Berrykins invading the town with jackhammers. The girls leave for the day to avoid the noise and not get in the workers’ way. Trying to make the best of the situation, Strawberry gets an idea for the girls to have fun by holding their own berry bitty relay race—passing the baton from a sailboat race on the lake, to a steeple chase on frogs, to a sky race on birds.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry takes his blue and red robots into Dino World so that he can continue the battle they were having at home, but without Nanas scorn.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: After watching a movie about the life of a Cleopatra, the gang go to Dino World to make Patsy Queen.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A young California Sea Lion makes a surprise appearance during Leo’s basketball game. Later, a voyage to find the sea lion’s home turns into a daring rescue on the high seas.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Snow comes early to the Island of Sodor – and it is heavier than usual! Donald and Douglas are coupled back-to-back with a van between their tenders and snowploughs on their fronts. Donald and Douglas keep squabbling about which line they should clear first, culminating in a big argument. Donald pulls away hard, snapping a damaged coupling and moving away with Douglas’s tender! So Douglas is left behind in the snow – without coal or water! The time apart helps cool the brothers’ tempers. They are delighted to be reunited in the end – and share water and coal from their tenders. Brothers!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: James likes to show off and be the centre of attention, but when he doesn’t get his own way, he sulks and pouts. One day James is showing off so much that the passengers start complaining so the Fat Controller takes his coaches away. James starts to pout and he is still pouting the next morning. He is so sulky and rude that the Fat Controller leaves him in his shed. Eventually James apologises and the Fat Controller gives him some work to do, but when James discovers that he’s pulling waste trucks he starts sulking again and it is only when his friends help him laugh at himself that James finally manages to find a way to dowhat he has to do, and even enjoy it!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: During an expedition to the jungle, Smeraldo finds an ancient vase from the dragons’ age. Since he needs help to carry the relic to his lab, Grisu will join him in the mission. The job isn’t easy, as the vase is very frail and a bunch of wild animals - especially some cheeky toucans - will get in their way. But with the help of Smeraldo, Olivia and Stella (who sneaked onboard to take part in the adventure), Grisu manages to carry the precious object to a safe place.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: A shooting star has been seen above Dragontown. At it fell in the surrondings, Pr. Smeraldo wants to find it before the wind and the rain bury the stone. Unfortunately, he has a wide area to comb. Its a perfect mission for Grisu and Stella. Equiped with a metal detector, Grisu has to deal with many obstacles, among them Thingy who turns mad every time he hears the detector beeping. And you cant imagine how many metal things lie around. Not only cant Grisu and Stella find the precious meteorite, but also they collect metal waste such as an old whistle, a magnet, wire or a weathervane.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare discovers Little Field Mouse has a wonderful collection of interesting Autumn leaves and Little Grey Squirrel has a collection of acorns of all varieties, he decides to start a collection of his own. But Little Nutbrown Hare cant decide what to collect, until his father encourages him to realise that he has a wonderful collection of memories.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare And Little Field Mouse are surprised to find an egg lying on the ground. Blue Bird agrees to look after it and when a rather odd and demanding bird hatches, she loves it like her own. When Little White Owl hears it calling one night, she tells them all that the ‘lucky chick’ is a baby owl and she will teach her all an owl needs to know.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: The sure way of stopping the arguments between Rosie and Scoutbadger is that Rosie’s parents get back together… at least that is what she will try and arrange…

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob, Leo, Muck and Scoop are at Fixham Castle to clear a courtyard wall and restore a bricked-up archway to its original splendour. Leo is taken by a statue of Sir Roger de Fixham riding a horse in the courtyard and Muck and Scoop play charging knights. After the wall is cleared they hear a strange beeping noise. It turns out to be Mr. Bentley who is searching for buried treasure with his metal detector. Bentley tells them The Legend of the Silver Shield – a shield that the knight on the statue originally held but which was later buried somewhere in the castle grounds. Scoop is transfixed! While Bob and the others knock out the bricks from the Archway, Scoop decides to dig around for buried treasure.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob tells a tired Scoop to stay behind at Bobs Yard as he goes to build an ice-cream kiosk at the beach. Scoop keeps finding spurious reasons to radio Bob and make him return to the yard. Finally there’s a real crisis but Bob doesnt believe its anything serious. Scoop takes a burning bin to the beach where it falls on the kiosk roof. Scoop saves the kiosk by scooping sand onto the roof.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Forgetful Mayor Fox has misplaced the giant key to the city that hes supposed to be presenting to a visiting astronaut. Huckle and his pals try to figure out where he set it down. They learn that Mayor Fox did one thing while touring a candy factory that required both his hands - stirring a huge pot of candy goo. Not far away they find a big chocolate-covered key./When Busytown residents are baffled by mysterious door knocking, Huckle and gang discover who it is.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: When a Sunda slow loris lands in the garden, the Junior Rangers quickly learn that they have to return it to the wild. Will they manage to find the slow loris a home? Or will the slow loris end up as a snack for a hungry sun bear?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Join the Junior Rangers as they race across the tundra to reunite a lost reindeer calf with its herd. However, a river crossing might prove too tiring for the young reindeer.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and his little brother Gaspard want to play with Daddy in the yard but he keeps disappearing in the weirdest ways. Daddy suggests they play hide and seek but instead of looking for them, he disappears again. He suggests they play soccer, but he kicks the ball over the fence and into the neighbor’s yard. Mommy comes home from the office. Daddy suggests they hurry inside for their snack. What in the world is Daddy up to anyway?? Simon finally understands: if Daddy wants them occupied elsewhere, it’s because he preparing a super surprise for them! And he is! He’s built them a tree house! Thank-you Daddy!!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Dolly goes for a walk, and finally she is enriched with a beautiful cherry and a good friend.

programme.desc: Berry becomes sad because he can not climb on the rainbow but Dolly makes him happy with an exceptionally creative present.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Flop teaches Bing and Pando how to blow bubbles. Bing finally blows a big bubble but gets upset when Pando pops it.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula head off for a picnic at the paddling pool with Flop. But when they get there, they are shocked to find there is no water inside. Bing’s disappointment soon gives way to the realisation that it’s a very special pool day. With no water there are all sorts of games they can play that are usually against the pool rules.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: During Bing’s bedtime routine he inadvertently pees on his blankie and it’s too wet to wash and dry before bed. Fortunately his Hoppity Voosh toy has a cape just as soft and huggy as blankie and it even smells just right too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco shows Bing how to do really good Big Boos and together they make Flop jump. When Bing tries out his new tricks on Charlie he finds out the power of Boo has to be scaled down for babies.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Molly’s wool that she just bought disappeared! She’s sure that it must have been stolen, so Tilda and Rupert found the Appleseed Detective Agency. Are the friends going to catch the burglar?

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert finds out that Molly has a beautiful singing voice and asks her if she can sing a song for Tildas birthday. Molly absolutely wants to do this but can she overcome her stage fright?

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda launches an herbal delivery service, and demand is huge. But Billy and Benny mix up orders: now Rupert cant sleep, and Robin sleeps through his morning song. Tilda must fix the chaos.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: After a long quiet winter in the meadow Little Nutbrown hare announces that he can’t wait for winter to be over so he can enjoy the other seasons with their special treats to see, hear and taste. Will the sound of icicles tinkling in the wind, the taste of a frozen Winter berry and some very unusual tracks in the snow convince the little hare that Winter is just as special as the other seasons?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare follows some unusual tracks in the snow that eventually lead him to a shy little spotty deer. He plays with his new friend every day, until she has to leave again with her mother to search for food. Little Nutbrown Hare is sad to see her go, but he’s also glad that he has friends that stay in the meadow all year round.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The snow in the meadow is so deep that Little Nutbrown Hare has to stay under the Old Oak tree. Wondering what he is going to do all day in deep snow and with no one to play with, his imagination soon takes over as he creates new kinds of fun. By the time his friends reach him, Little Nutbrown Hare can’t believe how the time has flown!

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Wilson is trying for his Fire Warden badge and is thrilled to be given his own siren. When the fire alarm goes off, he must sound his siren and make sure everybody leaves the area safely. Wilson gets a little carried away practising and doesn’t hear when the real alarm goes off. He is given another chance and this time concentrates and takes his responsibilities very seriously. When the alarm goes off during the night, he is able to evacuate the chuggers from the roundhouses quickly and calmly.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kai is struggling against the wind as he plods across the sandy, snowy dunes of the Gobi Desert. He gets impatient and tries to fly above with his hover boots but the wind was too strong, causing him to crash back on the sand dune. Kai then stumble upon an injured Bactrian Camel, with its leg being hurt. Back in the garden, Leo And Katie are playing Simon Says. Their game is cut short when Kai calls on Leos watch. After explaining the situation, the Junior Rangers agrees to help and travel to meet with Kai. Once they arrive, Leo is surprised how cold the environemnt is. Katie gives him an extra scarf and gloves. The Junior Rangers then meet up with Kai and the camel has a large rock stuck in its toes. Kai has an idea to use his grabber. Katie holds the leg as Leo tries to distract the animal while Kai pulls the rock out. Kai manages to success pull it out and Katie immediately disinfact the camels foot. The Junior Rangers then wants to reunite camel with its caravan, and they follow the camel who has already walk away. It was troubling for the Junior Rangers as the sand dune is hard to manuever. Katie has an idea to use their jetpack which Kai informs her its not a good idea.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kai is operating his drone to film for his film of the underwater environment. He recorded some fish but none are interesting to him. Then he encounters a starfish that piques his interest and think its the great subject for his film. Back in the garden, Katie are sketching Leo on her notepad as Leo poses. He moves as a fly keeps bugging him, making Katie irritated. Leo then receives a call from Kai who explain of the animal he discover. After learning more about it in the treehouse, the Junior Rangers agree to meetup with Kai in the ocean. Once they arrive, Kai instruct Leo And Katie to act around the starfish but theyre acting was bad. Kai films the starfish but it keeps doing nothing so he fall asleep while Leo and Katie are playing with Hero who is playing with a seashell. As Kai wakes up, they get greeted by Ranger Rocky. The Junior Rangers explain the situations causing him to call for Ranger Joey for more information on the animal. After learning useful tips, they found that the starfish had disappeared and later got carried away in a plastic bag stuck in by a sea turtle. Ranger Rocky manages to distract the sea turtle and Leo grab the plastic with his grabber. The starfish falls over and slowly fall over and reunite with other starfish. The day are saved and the Junior Rangers goes home. Back in the garden, Leo sees the sketch that Katie finished.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Nina is sure that her dog Loupiote is the fastest animal around! But T’choupi believes Brocoli the goat can move even faster! Nina rises to the challenge, and before you know it, Loupiote and Brocoli are unknowingly competing with each other in a race! But the dog and goat do whatever they please. And when Ciboulette the cat gets involved, it’s all downhill from there!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Tchoupi loves eating Fred’s goat’s cheese… but thinks again after getting a whiff of the goats’ pen: Ew!... So he’s very happy when Nina suggests they clean it out! Once they’re done with the cleaning, the two friends decide they could also make it more cozy. But shhh, not a word to anyone: it’s a surprise! However, after making the pen all spic and span and super comfortable, they’re shocked to find that the smell is still there!?! Thinking he’s found the perfect solution, Tchoupi sprays Mom’s perfume inside the pen… But what do the goats’ think of this new scent inside their house…?

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: While out walking in the forest, Benedicte sets a challenge for Tchoupi and Nina – to find their way back home all by themselves, using landmarks they come across along the way. But when they spot a squirrel, they momentarily forget to pay attention, and stray from the path back home...

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Daisy, the school’s assistant, has broken her leg and must stay at home. To help her feel better, the teacher has a very original idea for a present: a video with all the pupils! Unfortunately, when facing the camera, most of the children don’t know what to do with themselves… With the exception of Louis, who proves to be quite a natural!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam is passionately reading a book. But Julia accidentally damages the last few pages of it. How Julia could she reinvent for her friend the end of the interrupted story to calm Sams frustration?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia is impressed by Sarah, Sams older sister, who is preparing to sing on the theater stage. Julia does everything to attend the rehearsals but its not always easy to get noticed by a big girl.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Miss Gossip wants to write an article about Julia, as a recent inhabitant. The journalist needs informations about her island, from a book that belong to Julias mother, so not to be loosed...

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Emily worries she doesnt have a best friend, but, when the other engines help her out of a tricky situation, she realises shes been surrounded by best friends all along.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas befriends a stray dog who is wandering around the railway and tries to find him a home. In the process, Thomas derails and the fuzzy little dog raises the alarm.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou has to join a new class for the day, and hes mega nervous! He imagines his new, temporary classmates as Aliens on a new planet. While at first he feels lonely, over the course of the day Caillou makes anew friend, River, and realizes the new class isnt so scary after all!

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: When Caillou goes first for Show And Tell and needs to use the "How Am I Feeling" Board to express his emotions, its confusing at first, but as he recounts the story of his Grandmas birthday, he finds that no matter how you feel, you can always choose kindness.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: When Huckle and the gang hear strange mumbling voices in the Busytown Museum, it begins to look like it’s coming from the new Mummy Exhibit. However, after tracking down the clues and putting them together, the sounds turn out to be the voices of the workmen echoing up through air vents from the basement.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: The chef Monkey wants to make his famous banana honey sandwich. He discovers that there is no honey, parrot eat it all. Mole appears and tells them of the bees honey making abilities. They journey off to the meadow where they meet a sweet honeybee who not only supplies them with honey, but also joins them in a fun game of Monkey See Monkey Do!!!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: During a search and rescue drill on Annie’s Farm, Penny and Annie’s childhood rivalry leads to a heated game of hide and seek, a runaway horse, and a river rescue on board Hydrus and Phoenix.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Mandy leads a whirlwind tour of the Seven Wonders of Pontypandy, but her haste to make it to all seven leads to a fire at her campsite!

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: While doing their “Who’s Who in Woodland” project - a school assignment where the kids have to find out more about the people in their community - Franklin and Bear assume they already know all there is to know about Mr. Groundhog. But in doing so they almost miss out on a bunch of cool stuff, like the fact he’s actually Woodland’s own expert weatherman! / When Franklin and Fox decide they want to be inventors just like Mr. Fox, they find that tinkering and experimenting are just as important to the process as following a plan. With open minds, they even invent some pretty cool gadgets along the way!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Edmond lives happily with his three little badger cubs in their underground sett. One day, he falls in love with Marguerite, a fox! Marguerite and her daughter move into the family home, turning life upside-down for everyone, who now needs to find a new way to live together in harmony.Directed by: Florian Ferrier (France, 2018)

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: What does a king love to do on the beach? Doodleboo explains how to draw a Castle.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Who loves to learn new tricks ? Doodleboo explains how to draw a Dolphin.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: What do you need for a great birthday? Doodleboo explains how to draw a birthday cake.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave harvest the hay down on the farm. They have to keep counting and checking their nine bales of hay to ensure they are all safely put away in the barn before it rains - and a fun harvest song helps them remember how many bales they should have!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Hatty’s garden is in a messy muddle and he wants to know ‘why’? Hatty always tidies his things away, but today there’s a pumpkin on the path and tools and sticks scattered all around the garden! It’s up to Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave to clean up, putting everything back in its proper place, and solve the ‘Mystery of the Messy Muddler’.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: When Little Nutbrown Hare discovers Little Field Mouse has a wonderful collection of interesting Autumn leaves and Little Grey Squirrel has a collection of acorns of all varieties, he decides to start a collection of his own. But Little Nutbrown Hare cant decide what to collect, until his father encourages him to realise that he has a wonderful collection of memories.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare And Little Field Mouse are surprised to find an egg lying on the ground. Blue Bird agrees to look after it and when a rather odd and demanding bird hatches, she loves it like her own. When Little White Owl hears it calling one night, she tells them all that the ‘lucky chick’ is a baby owl and she will teach her all an owl needs to know.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare And Little Field Mouse go on an adventurous journey through the woods in search of a special Autumn leaf. They leave a trail of acorns to find their way home, but Little Grey Squirrel unwittingly collects the acorns and leaves them all lost in the woods. Luckily he is able to help when he climbs to the treetops and spies the meadow in the distance.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: At Ammas crèche a butterfly lands on Sulas painting. Bing tries to help it go outside but accidentally squishes it. Flop and Amma help the sad children say goodbye.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The playful rabbit wants to draw a big picture, so Flop finds him some chalk to create a stripy, spotty, zig-zag dinosaur on the pavement

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula find a potato in Amma’s vegetable patch with a comical ‘face’, so they take it under their wing, naming it “Nosey”. The two children look after Nosey and show him around the crèche but unfortunately Nosey goes down the slide too quickly and his ‘nose’ falls off. Amma shows them how to plant both bits of potato so that they can grow new potatoes.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing discovers a hole in his favourite yellow wellies but he doesnt want to throw them away in the stinky dustbin.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop hear the familiar jingle of Gillys ice cream van and race across the park to find her. After a long run Bing finally gets his ice cream but as he waves goodbye to Gilly he tips the ice cream out of the cone.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On Reggie Squirrel’s seventh birthday, he couldnt find his friends at home. He runs into Harry Hedgehog, who offers to take him for a ride in a carriage. When they return, the forest inhabitants celebrate Reggie Squirrel together, giving him seven candles as a gift. They then fly in a hot air balloon, marveling at the night sky. Finally, Reggie Squirrel happily returns home and wishes his friends a good night.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble and Stanley gather chestnuts, and then they create marvelous figures out of them at the house of the stag beetle. Bubble takes the figures home, but upon seeing the mess, Stanley offers his help. In the process, they get caught up in a series of accidents, resulting in the gingerbread house breaking. Bubble receives a new gingerbread house from Rosita the rose beetle and happily tidies up his room.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The green Grub wants to stay with Dolly for the winter, but always finds her at the wrong time with the request. The Wind accidentally blows the The Green Grub to the seaside, then brings it back to Dolly. Finally, Dolly happily welcomes the Green Grub for the winter and prepares a comfortable bed for him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly 05 Mepe
programme.desc: Berry the snail and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They have many adventures, while they make new friends and get knowledge about the world around them.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids search for the owner of a sketchbook that contains drawings done from a high point of view. After determining the artist wasnt drawing at the top of a ladder or up in a tree, they discover the sketchbook belongs to one of Busytowns tallest residents, Jeremy Giraffe. / Huckle and gang investigate a strange temperature drop which turns Busytowns summer to winter.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: It is nap time at the campsite but monkey cant fall asleep so he is walking back and forth counting his footsteps. Monkey hopes that Bear can help him fall asleep so they venture over to the tundra. There they meet a young Grizzly bear cub who too has problems going to sleep. Bear joins them for a fun game of Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When filming a tourism advert about Pontypandy, Sarah gets carried away with her filming. When she climbs a mountain to get the perfect shot, she ends up stranded on a ledge. Meanwhile Elvis decides it would be a good idea to set up a souvenir stall selling jars of Pontypandy Firefighter Pickles.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Peter creates a wild and adventurous trail for Scoop Dooley to follow, they both end up getting lost. Meanwhile, when Radar destroys Shadow’s favourite toy, Sergeant Ravani and Sam work hard to fix it!

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper, Tiger and Jake are having a day on the river. It takes ages to do up their lifejackets and Tiger loses his cap. Jake rows them in a circle and Tiger does a special knot to tie the boat up when they stop for lunch but it comes undone and the boat drifts away. By the end of the day they are glad to be back on dry land.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper is waiting for Pig and Arnold at the duck pond when a small friendly robot clanks out of the water. At Kipper’s house it tries a piece of bread, a milk shake and some chocolate cookies but when Kipper introduces Hippo, to his horror, the robot eats him too! Happily Kipper and Hippo are reunited at the duck pond.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi spots a baby rabbit at the edge of the garden. Taking pity on this lone animal, he decides he wants to keep it. So he introduces it to Plume and Plumeau, hoping they’ll all play together. But despite his good intentions, T’choupi realizes before long that you can’t just invite any random guest into your home…

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Nina and Dad have fun imitating birdsongs and are very good at it. Tchoupi, however, is totally unable to join in: singing like a bird isn’t his forte! Frustrated, he suggests they play hide And seek in the forest instead. Nina’s fine with it… as long as they do a "special kind of hide And seek," using birdsongs to find each other! T’choupi opts for the simplest song of all: a cuckoo, with its characteristic "kookoo" greeting: Kookoo, kookoo!

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Grandma Gouda challenges a timid Sam to tell a story in front of an audience at the next party she hosts. How could he overcome his stage fright. Julia has some ideas to help her friend...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Invited to dinner at Sams house, Julia makes a stain on the tablecloth while Sams mom is away. Time is running : can Sam and Julia wash the stain and fix Julias big mistake before the dinner?

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert builds soapbox cars, and Billy and Benny race them excitedly. Edna thinks its too dangerous and secures the track, while Karl and Molly struggle with near-sightedness and fear.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets are quietly playing cards on the top bunk and Turbulent is taking all the place, which annoys Girl and Poet. Turbulent replies that if theyre unhappy, they can leave HIS bed! For Turbulent, his bed is a dungeon and you can only enter with the right imaginary ticket ! To get even with him, Girl and Poet decide to make their bed become an hotel and a restaurant in THEIR bed. And Turbulent is not welcome. Nobody is happy with their place anymore. Mommy will have to find a clever way to close the argument.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: Today Poet is sick, he can’t go to school and Mommy decides to prepare him a good hot milk with honey. Girl and Turbulent are so jealous and they wonder if Poet would not be Mommy’s favorite! Once they come home from school, they even find Poet in Mommy’s bed: there is no doubt anymore, he is her favorite! They decide to take a drastic decision, they will leave the house, let Mommy and Poet alone and they will regret it. But Mommy has a solution of her own to put an end to this conflict.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Edmond lives happily with his three little badger cubs in their underground sett. One day, he falls in love with Marguerite, a fox! Marguerite and her daughter move into the family home, turning life upside-down for everyone, who now needs to find a new way to live together in harmony.Directed by: Florian Ferrier (France, 2018)

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Mommy comes down with the Sniffle-Diffles and is unable to take Caillouand Rosie to the fair, so they decide to "make her better," with thehelp of Nurse Daddy. In the end, they forget all about the fair, havingso much fun helping Mommy.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: On a super hot day, Caillou and Leo competitively play a lava level ofDig n Build. When Daddy tries plugging in a fan, he ends upoverloading the circuits, turning the TV and game off! As Leo andCaillou swelter in the heat, they begin to imagine lava rising in thehouse. They learn to work together to help save Gilbert from the lavaand get their game (and the AC) back on!

programme.title: Thomas and Friends
programme.desc: When Philip shows off to James about how many trucks he can pull, James decides to prove that he is the stronger engine by pulling a very long train. Soon disaster strikes as James can’t control all of the trucks and comes off the rails breaking through the side of a stone bridge. Philip races to save James and the brave little engine slips under James to rescue his new friend from falling and props him up until help arrives.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Cormac loves to be busy, but when a problem at the docks means there are no deliveries, he finds himself at a loose end. He drives all over Chuggington offering his help but nobody needs him. He wanders into Chug Patrol HQ, but nobody is there. Cormac jumps when an emergency call from Jackman suddenly comes through. The Chug Patrollers have gone up the mountain to practise search and rescue techniques but the weather has turned stormy and lightning has split a rock, trapping them. Cormac yells that he’s on his way. Finally he has a job to do!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Harrison wants to be a tour guide, but first he must pass the test: devising a special tour. He plans to go around his favourite parts of Chuggington, but needs a special place to end his tour. While searching, Harrison discovers working parts of Chuggington that he’s never seen before, but doesn’t find his special place. Time is running out and a dusty Harrison rushes back to the Working Wheels Yard for a wash but they are too busy to fit him in. Harrison is distraught. He cant give a tour looking like this!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Daisy, the school’s assistant, has broken her leg and must stay at home. To help her feel better, the teacher has a very original idea for a present: a video with all the pupils! Unfortunately, when facing the camera, most of the children don’t know what to do with themselves… With the exception of Louis, who proves to be quite a natural!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: In an exciting game of opposites, Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave discover that "opposite" means ‘most different, and explore pairs of words that describe opposite states and actions.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Nina are excited to be looking after a guest - a friend’s "unique" rooster by the name of Rigoletto. They ask Fred what makes it so unique but he’s not sure; all he knows is that they need to take good care of it. However, despite being housed in its very own enclosure, Rigoletto escapes and goes missing!! Huh! Maybe the animal’s "uniqueness" will allow the kids to track it down…?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah was driving her dirt bike but she stops as she hears a loud cries, grabbing her attention. She investigate and finds a baby moon bear crying for help. Back in the garden, Katie and Leo are playing tag. Leo blocks Katies path to touch Hero but Katie manages to tricks him. But Hero manages to escape as he was distracted by a butterfly. Suddenly, Farah calls for help through Leos watch, informing them of the poor animal cub with her. After the Junior Rangers learn that its a Moon Bear cub and wanting to help, they travel to meet up with Farah by riding PlatypusOne. Once theyre there, Farah tells them she has name the cub Cubby. Katie then reads her tablet and says that moon bear need to learn how to climb trees, swim, mark territories and communicate with other bears to survive, hence a montage happens of the Junior Rangers. Then they try teaching Cubby how to growl like a bear so they all imitate bear growling. Cubby gives it a try but struggle to do it. Ranger Rocky randomly appears and the Junior Rangers tells him of their situation. Ranger Rocky decides to call out his dear friend Ranger Joey and asks for help.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
