programme.desc: In April, the Pigeon post brings the ants a bouncy castle. Its Dr Owls task to invite everyone for the jumping session, but Berry is nowhere to be found. Hail interrupts the jumping fun, but the friends seek shelter in the ant castle. The toy gets damaged, but with the help of a cloud, Berry can also join the jumping. Then the ants rebuild the castle, and everyone happily continues jumping.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Balthazar and Stanley are building a raft that gets carried away by the stream. They end up far from home, but then decide to head back during a storm. Christopher, the canary helps them, but they fall off during a gust of wind. They find refuge in a hollow to rest where they are finally discovered and helped to go home by the Spider. The next day, they play along the stream again, but they no longer worry if the raft run away.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, tries to bake an apple pie, but unfortunately, it doesnt turn out well. With the help of a fairy, she manages to fix it and then finds a lost marker and repairs the window as well. The Lily Fairy discovers that Flutter solved everything on her own and then moves on to help others.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Alfonso, the cricket, invites Bubble, Berry, and Dolly for a visit. They make ice cream and play together. Bubble admits to cheating in the game. Because of this, the little friends come up with a new game where everyone can win."

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest gather on the hilltop to watch the evening meteor shower. Stanley and Balthazar want to build a seesaw but constantly encounter obstacles. The Firefly helps them, and with the assistance of the Moon, they swing on the Moon rocker seesaw. The meteor shower mesmerizes them, then they bid farewell to each other, and everyone starts heading home. The Firefly falls asleep contentedly.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: When the children make Eggy heads with eggs and cress seeds, Bing gets impatient and wants his cress to grow quicker so he decides to give Eggy lots of water with the garden hose.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: The bunny gets jealous when Sula gives Pando more attention on a playdate. He tries to gain some for himself and ends up being pushed, so Amma show them how to get rid of the anger

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is playing the talking lettuce game on Flops phone when he drops the phone and accidentally breaks it

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and his friends put on a show in the park. After Coco’s dance, Pando’s song and Sula’s acrobatics display everyone is excited to see Bing’s finale. When he gets up on the stage Bing is overcome with stage fright so his friends, and rainbow fairy mice, come to the rescue.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing tries to show Sula she doesnt need to wear earmuffs to watch the fireworks but when a loud bang sends Bing flying, he doesnt think they are such a bad idea!

programme.title: Bing Bunny - Shorts and characters
programme.desc: Get to know our little pets better through charming stories featuring the characters from the popular Bing series.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon and his family are spending the weekend at Grandma and Grandpas, but Simon is finding that he has to do lots of things around the house while Gaspard doesnt do anything!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Edmond lives happily with his three little badger cubs in their underground sett. One day, he falls in love with Marguerite, a fox! Marguerite and her daughter move into the family home, turning life upside-down for everyone, who now needs to find a new way to live together in harmony.Directed by: Florian Ferrier (France, 2018)

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is impressed by Blue Bird’s description of a flowery field that looks just like a sea of colour from her bird’s eye view. He visits the field with Big Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse, and they discover that everyone has their own unique view of the field, and each one is special in its own way.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One gorgeous Summer morning Big Nutbrown Hare wakes to find Little Nutbrown Hare enthralled by a story of Little White Owl’s. Encouraged, Little Nutbrown Hare sets off to make up a story of his own, but finds it harder than he thought to come up with one. With the help of his father, he finally uses some fruit he’s collected on the way to help him tell a very colourful tale.

programme.title: Boribon
programme.desc: Its snowing at last! Boribon goes sledding with Annalee. They have a snowball fight and build a snowman - and the snowman goes home with them. How is this possible?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: The triplets are hard to put to sleep. Just as hard as Sams dad was! says Grandma. The only thing that used to put him to sleep was an old mobile, but its completely out of order...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia dreams of joining the residences brass band, except that to do so, she must come with a musical instrument. Sam builds one for her, but Julia is too impatient to listen at her friends advice.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: When her little girl says she wants to become a doctor, mom tells her that it takes a lot of work. Surely enough, Girl decides to start training right away, with her first aid kit. Poet and Turbulent are her first patients, but the two boys are quite annoyed by their consultation. Girl tries to heal Toto and finally her teddy bears but they too seem rather ungrateful. So how about becoming a doll doctor?

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The triplets are enjoying a day at the beach with their mom. Unfortunately, Girl starts having the hiccups and cannot get rid of it, despite her brothers many tricks and advice. Strangely enough, a seagull is finally going to cure her...But guess who has the hiccups now?

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Tyne tunnels through the mountain, while the rest of the chuggineers are hard at work finishing a bridge for the new high - speed link to Tootington. Just as Tyne is about to break through, Brewster averts disaster by spotting that a track joint hasn’t been welded. Zack gets it done in the nick of time and Tyne and the tunnel - boring machine drive safely out onto the new bridge. As a gesture of appreciation, Zack names the bridge after Brewster.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When filming a tourism advert about Pontypandy, Sarah gets carried away with her filming. When she climbs a mountain to get the perfect shot, she ends up stranded on a ledge. Meanwhile Elvis decides it would be a good idea to set up a souvenir stall selling jars of Pontypandy Firefighter Pickles.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Peter creates a wild and adventurous trail for Scoop Dooley to follow, they both end up getting lost. Meanwhile, when Radar destroys Shadow’s favourite toy, Sergeant Ravani and Sam work hard to fix it!

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper is excited when he looks out and sees snow. He practises sledging with Big Owl before he and Tiger go to the snowy park. They watch the ducks skidding on the icy pond and realise they can’t any food when the water’s frozen over. Kipper and Tiger come to the rescue with a sledge full of bread.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Jake seems to be playing with someone Kipper and Tiger can’t see. When Jake introduces Wilbur to them, Kipper and Tiger feel they should pretend to see him too. By the time they’ve all has ice cream and lemonade no one is sure whether Wilbur exists or not.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: When Caillou’s friends mistakenly think that his dad is a treasure hunter, Caillou feels very special until Ms. Martin invites Daddy to visit his class. Unsure what to do, Caillou pretends to be an explorer whose assistant (Daddy) must learn to be honest in order to find the treasure.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: Caillou wants his cold to go away immediately so he can play pirates with his friends. But when he goes into a pirate captain fantasy and rushes though his ship’s repairs instead of taking the time to fix it properly, he realizes how important it is to be patient with his own body.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: In an attempt to beat Thomas in a race, Cleo decides to use the railway lines instead of the road. She soon learns that the roads are much safer for a little car.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: On the vibrant shores of an Indonesian island, Kai embarks on a thrilling adventure with his revolutionary Kaizer Drone, equipped with a cutting-edge animal translator capable of converting dolphin squeals into human speech. Later, he stumbles upon a mysterious whale that bore an uncanny resemblance to a fearsome shark. Meanwhile, in a nearby garden, Leo and Katie engage in training sessions with their loyal canine companion, Hero, using a bag of delectable animal treats to hone his communication skills. Amidst Heros baffling barks, Leo receives an urgent call from Kai, who unveils his astonishing discovery. Captivated by the intrigue, Katie and Leo agree to rendezvous with Kai when they learn that the magnificent whale shark has become ensnared in a fishing net. As the Junior Rangers arrive at Kais location, clad in their sleek wetsuits, they confront the sight of the majestic creature helplessly entangled. Contemplating the potential risks of liberating a shark, they find solace in the sudden arrival of Ranger Rocky, who imparts words of caution. Seeking expert advice, the Junior Rangers connect with Ranger Joey, who enlightens them on the harmless nature of the whale shark. After bidding farewell to Ranger Rocky, they summon their courage and attempt to free the captive creature.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Farah was bird gazing in the rainforest, to which then she hears a birdcall from an unknown bird. She finally locates it and sees a unique male Superb Bird of Paradise, in the middle of doing its courting dance. Fascinated, Farah plans to call the Junior Rangers in learning more. Back in the garden, Leo And Katie are having a friendly dancing competition. Hero joins them for a moment before Leo receives a call from Farah. Farah shares the bird picture to them and they learned its a Superb Bird of Paradise. They then worried if the bird might be injured so the Junior Rangers agree in meeting with Farah. The Junior Rangers arrives and quietly meet with Farah as they hide behind some bushes. They notice the bird is cleaning an open area. Misunderstood of the situation, the Junior Rangers thought the bird need help of building a nest so they scatter around to find materials to give to the bird. As they try to give the bird the materials they gather, the bird gets upset and clean again. Confused of the situation, they then get greeted by Ranger Rocky.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Meera orders an extra-special teddy for her baby brother Nik and his teddy bears picnic.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: When the water tower falls across the train tracks at the station halt, it’s Pat’s job to pick it up using his helicopter and a giant super 3 magnet. The Magnet soon starts attracting objects - Alf’s spade, PC Selby’s hat, Pumpkin’s bridle, from all over Pencaster and Greendale. A chase ensues as Amy, Alf and PC Selby race to get their metal objects back from Pat. Pat needs to save the day and lift the water tower off the tracks before the Pencaster Flyer comes into the station…

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Sula and Bing tag all their favourite things around the house with stickers, but when Sula tags Hoppity Voosh Bing is upset because he doesnt want to share.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants Flop to read him a story when he has his bath but gets sad when his book gets wet. Flop helps him to understand that even though the book is wet, the story isnt.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing has a great time choosing the perfect present for Sula in Padgets shop. Its a wand and is sparkly and flashy and spinny and Bing knows that she will love it. Bing is thrilled until it is time to hand the present over.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing wants to try Coco’s Hula Hoop. It’s harder than it looks but he finds lots of other hoopy games as he tries. Just as Bing almost gets it right he gets carried away with spinning, trips over and breaks the hoop. Coco is upset that she can’t hula anymore until Bing and Charlie remind her of all the other games they can still do with the bent hoop.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula are in the park playing at being giants and splashing in puddles with their big welly boots. As they play the puddles get bigger and bigger until Bing slips over in the mud and gets wet everywhere. Amma comes to the rescue with a giant warm bath and a giant carroty bagel.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: When Henry’s Cousin Louie comes to stay, Henry starts feeling homesick for the Frozen North. He decides there and then to go back with Cousin Louie and a sad Oswald goes round Big City to tell all of their friends. They gather at the bus stop to wish Henry bon voyage when suddenly a gust of wind takes the party balloons up into the air – along with Catrina! Everyone ends up hanging onto the balloons for dear life and Henry realises he has to make a choice - save his friends or catch the bus…

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: While housesitting for Henry, Daisy breaks his favourite fish vase. Oswald advises her to simply tell Henry what happened, but Daisy, worried that Henry will be angry with her, is sure theres another way out. She tries to mend the vase, buy a new one, and make a replica, but all her efforts fail. Daisy despairs, but Oswald reminds her that she has ruffled Henrys feathers many times before and they are still friends. Daisy confesses the truth to Henry only to discover he has an entire cupboard full of fish vases!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Bob announces there’s been a Spring City Clock Competition to design the new Spring City Clock – and guess who’s won? The Spring City Rockets! Bob shows the Machines their winning design and explains that metal figures will emerge and sound the bells on the clock. Wendy has been welding the metal figures together. Leo arrives and is looking forward to helping Bob with the decorative cladding around the clock tower but Bob tells him it’s Recycling Day today and his job is to take all the recycling to the Centre first. Bob and the Machines set off to the site while Leo and Muck gather up the boxes of recycling from around the Yard. But Leo is in such a hurry that he mistakes the box with the metal figures in for recycling and dumps it at the Recycling Centre.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Saffi has won a “Design a Statue” competition and now Bob and the team are turning her design into a water-fountain for the shopping mall. Saffi explains that her elephant statue design was based on her favourite toy, Mr Trunkers, but has since lost him. So when Muck is chosen to deliver the elephant statue, he promises to take extra special care of it for Saffi. But in his excitement, Muck accidentally knocks the elephant into a wall and scrapes off its paint. Muck can’t quite bring himself to own up to Saffi, so decides to tell Bob what has happened first. On his way to tell Bob, Muck overhears Anish telling Saffi how proud he is of her statue. Muck panics and ends up damaging the elephant more.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: It is a sunny Spring day in the meadow and Little Nutbrown Hare is enjoying all it has to offer. As the day wears on a heavy grey cloud forces Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse to seek shelter from the rain. Will the friends let a little water ruin their fun or will they discover that rainy days can be just as exciting.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is disappointed when a trail of ants disappears with the delicious Spring berries he’s found. He’s convinced that ants are not very nice, and only after Big Nutbrown Hare explains how the ants were probably taking the berries home to their families does Little Nutbrown Hare forgive them. And when he sees how clever the ants are, he soon wants to be like them.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The Summer meadow is home to a many amazing treasures of nature. When Little Nutbrown Hare finds a beautiful blue butterfly, he and Little Field Mouse go on a hunt for other blue treasures to bring back and show Big Nutbrown Hare, including blueberries, blue bells and even blue eggshells. Meanwhile, Big Nutbrown Hare has discovered the biggest blue treasure of them all. What could it be?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: Each episode of centres around a narrative story, introducing key vocabulary and addressing specific learning outcomes, finishing with a reward dance to congratulate the viewer for completing the lesson.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: All the balls at Farmer Patrick Pigs new mini putt are disappearing. After much investigation Huckle and the gang track the missing balls to Patricks record breaking ‘egg laying’ chicken. / When the gold coins Mr Fix It finds on the beach disappear, Huckle, Lowly and Sally set out to find out where they went.

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: When Messy accidentally sets Farmer Fuddles sheep loose, he must help round them up in time for their annual wool shearing. But will Messy be brave enough to get a fur-cut of his own?

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Messy cant remember where he left his favourite sock. He goes to Okido and learns how to jog his memory, but when the rollercoaster breaks down, will he be able to help Stan Tall remember where he left his screwdriver?

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: The continuing problem with the town’s power keeps the Berrykin crews digging and the girls from doing their work—especially frustrating Cherry, who is struggling to write a song. Strawberry rallies their spirits by suggesting a fun way for them to spend the day out of town: a treasure hunt! The girls divide into two teams, each leaving clues for the other that lead to funny objects. The team that collects all the objects first, wins the grand prize—a bag of banana chips from Strawberry’s Cafe that look like gold coins. While the girls have fun, Berrykins Ed and Earl struggle to uncross the crossed juice cables under the cafe floor. The power problem has given the appliances a life of their own, resulting in Earl thinking the cafe is haunted!

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry returns from a day out at a theme park and finds that Steggy is missing.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry wants to grow some roses for Mothers day but he needs them to grow in just one day so he goes to Dino-World where flowers grow quickly.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: The Junior Rangers have a brush with a poacher as they try to return an Indian Star Tortoise to its home in the scrub forest.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: A storm is approaching and Skiff and Joe, the Lighthouse Keeper, patrol Arlesburgh, helping everyone to prepare for it. Duck and Oliver don’t think a ‘tiny little railboat’ should be out in a storm and it seems they are right when Skiff’s anchor rope snaps and his sail unfurls. Skiff is terrified as he gets blown down the track and right into a tree that lightning has brought down across the branchline. When Skiff realises that both Oliver and Duck are heading towards the tree he manages to raise his sail to warn them and avert a serious accident.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: When the Fat Controller gives Daisy the job of conveying some special passengers up to the holiday town of Harwick, she gets carried away with the responsibility – deciding that, because she is a very special engine, they must be very special passengers! Not stopping for a group of children with sticky ice lollies and refusing to pull a dusty baggage truck results in the passengers not being able to perform their puppet show! Once the audience has been specially bussed in for the show, Daisy is humbled as she becomes a puppet stand for the performance of… a Punch And Judy puppet show!

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Toramento is exhausted because of his job, so Grisu tries to help him by boosting a malfunctioning and slow cleaning robot to do the job in his place. But the boosted robot is not easy to control and makes a mess all around the city, also because Thingy wants to play with it, sending the machine haywire. Eventually Grisu understands that Toramento doesn’t need a robot doing the job in his place, but a care-giving device that provides coffee and massages, keeping his stamina up.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Checking the safety items at the watch tower in the forest, Emma realizes that the alarm system doesnt work anymore. Grisu suggest using the old fire station alarm bell. Great idea! Unfortunately, David, whos supposed to set it up, is called for an intervention and must leave. Grisu offers his help.Here is Grisu and Stella heading to the forest with the old bell on a cart. The noisy bell creates some confusion in the forest since everybody thinks theres a fire. Not mentioning Michel, Gertruds very talkative parrot who cant help but imitating every sound and voice he hears. The mission turns into a catastrophe when Grisu burns the bell… right when a fire starts into the forest. But Grisu is resourceful, as always, and he uses Michel as a spare alarm bell.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare And Little Field Mouse go on an adventurous journey through the woods in search of a special Autumn leaf. They leave a trail of acorns to find their way home, but Little Grey Squirrel unwittingly collects the acorns and leaves them all lost in the woods. Luckily he is able to help when he climbs to the treetops and spies the meadow in the distance.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Spring is coming and Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are very brave and go on a journey through the meadow to discover the source of a mysterious – and slightly spooky - creaking sound. They follow the clues to discover… it’s the frozen lake melting, and singing as it does!

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Martis has a very distinctive laugh and this becomes an attraction for his friends - until the moment that the joke no longer makes him laugh at all.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mayor Madison has commissioned a skate park so that the Spring City Rockets can enter an online action sports video. As Bob and the team set to work building it, Scoop, Muck and Lofty ask Leo if he can skate. Although he’s never actually set foot on a board, Leo gets swept up in the moment and boasts that he’s an amazing skateboarder, nicknamed “Lightning Leo”. When Brandon announces that they need one more rider to join them in the video (competition rules) Dizzy is keen to have a go, demonstrating her skill on four wheels. But the machines insist Lightning Leo should be in it... and suddenly Leo finds himself slated for a “Battle of the Boards” contest with Dizzy once the skate park has been completed. He dashes off to buy a skateboard kit (including an action camera), and returns to the park to practice.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: There is a sand sculpture competition taking place on Fixham Beach and Leo is the designated Weather Forecaster for the day; his weather app assures him there is a heat-wave on the way. Mayor Madison is judging the teams (including late entrants Bob and Wendy) but loses a special loaned ring. The partly built sand sculptures are demolished in the search but the ring still isn’t found, so Mr Bentley fetches his metal detector and combs the beach while the sculptures are rebuilt. When the skies darken ominously, Leo realises he’s been checking the wrong Spring City and that a freak storm is heading for them.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Red spots suddenly begin appearing on everything in Busytown from Mr. Rabbit’s mail box to Hilda Hippo’s roof! Huckle ultimately discovers that the red spots are really juice marks made from cherries falling from overhanging trees. / A teeny weeny piano motivates Huckle, Sally and Lowly to try to figure out who would own such a small instrument.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A visit to the mangrove swamp is in order when Leo and Hero find a baby estuarine crocodile in the garden. Can the Junior Rangers find the baby crocodile’s nest while avoiding the adult crocodiles that roam the swamp?

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Leo finds a baby plantain squirrel eating his seed collection. The Junior Rangers drive to the forest to locate the squirrel’s nest and mother.

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon has found a wounded bird in the yard. With help from his younger brother Gaspard, he decides to look after him. Simon takes a real liking to the bird, he becomes his friend. He even gives him a name: Feather. With help from daddy, he builds him a nest, finds him seeds to eat. But the bird recovers and one day, flies off without Simon even noticing. Saddened by his departure, Simon looks all over for him. Finally, the bird reappears and shows Simon his real nest. Simon gets to meet the bird’s whole family and realizes how much better it is for him to be with other birds in his natural element. He is so happy that Feather has found his Mommy and Daddy again!

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: It turns out whether there are witches or not, and that it is not nice to frighten others.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly goes to the kindergarten and the day passes fast with lot of interesting plays.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Balthazar really gets to like the unknown bumblebee girl, and with the help of the friends he even builds a house for her.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly accidentally ruin the snowman of Balthazar but finally they build an even nicer one jointly.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Berry and Dolly insist on seeing an octopus. They manage to get to the home island of the octopus and in the way back home rainbow-fishes help them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The violin of the poor Cricket breaks. Berry and Dolly takes care that neither the Cricket nor the other animals remain without instrument and music.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Dolly helps Christopher, the canary who broke his wing. In gratitude Christopher takes Dolly to the island where the yellow ladybird lives.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula discover a new toy at Amma’s crèche, a talking ride on car. It seems like fun until Talkie Taxi keeps saying the same thing over and over again. When the taxi crashes and is finally silenced Bing and Sula use their imagination to play a game they really want to play without being dictated to by the noisy taxi.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: It’s a windy day and Bing wants to fly his Hoppity Voosh kite with Flop. And he wants to do it all by himself. Even when Pando arrives and wants to help Bing insists on doing it his way. When the kite gets caught up in the park bench Bing realises that there are some times when another pair of hands comes in handy.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: It’s bath time and Bing just can’t help adding a few more quirts of bubble goo…and a few more….and a few more, until he gets more bubbles than he can handle.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing goes to play with Sula who is engrossed in a game of ‘sparkle magic’ when he arrives. Bing wants to play too but Sula finds all sorts of reasons why Bing can’t play with her special sparkly things. Amma suggests that Bing makes his own sparkle magic stone but disaster strikes when Bing accidentally spills Sula’s precious sparkle dust.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Rupert builds soapbox cars, and Billy and Benny race them excitedly. Edna thinks its too dangerous and secures the track, while Karl and Molly struggle with near-sightedness and fear.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda and Rupert are on a boat trip when they suddenly find themselves stranded on dry land. Where has the water gone? They meet Berta, the beaver girl, and discover her dam is the cause.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Billy loses his baby tooth and places it under his pillow. He and Benny want to see the Tooth Fairy, so they stay awake. Eventually, they go out at night searching for her.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: On a cold but sunny morning in the middle of Winter, Little Nutbrown Hare discovers his friends ice-skating on the frozen pond. He decides to give it a try but slips, slops and slides all over the ice. Will he persevere for long enough to be able to perfect his own unique style, or will he be put off by the natural skill of his friends?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse go on a long trip with Big Nutbrown Hare to find some food he hid away during the warmer months. Little Nutbrown Hare plays with a stick along the way, which turns out to have many uses, one of which is helping them find the food and another is finding their way home again.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare is very proud of a Christmas Tree he has built from pine cones. So proud, that when Little Field Mouse accidentally knocks it over he has trouble forgiving her. When he makes a mistake of his own, Big Nutbrown Hare forgives him immediately, and he understands how important it is to forgive.

programme.title: Chuggington Badge Quest
programme.desc: Wilson is flown to a secret location by Action Chugger and has to navigate his way home, using Dr. Ling’s new invention – the Chugnav. When a squirrel accidentally knocks the Chugnav upside down and back to front, causing it to malfunction, Wilson gets hopelessly lost. But once he figures out that he should do the opposite of what the Chugnav tells him, he gets back safely and earns his badge!

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: As Kyle was kayaking near the shoreline to test his speed, he stumble upon a plastic bottle drifting in the water. He picks it up and notice a strange animal inside of it. Back in the garden, Leo And Katie are playing a guessing game. Leo sees a ladybug and have Katie guess it, which she has a hard time answering. Hero, their dog, appears and chase away the ladybug from the flower, causing Leo to lose their game because he cant show it to Katie. Leo then receives a call from Kyle who show him of the fascinating animal. After learning more information on Katies computer, the Junior Rangers agree to meetup with Kyle there to help return the animal to its habitat. Once arriving there, Kyle shows the Blue Sea Dragon to the Junior Rangers. Katie and Leo try looking for a suitable to relocate the animal with Katies tablet, unknowingly seeing that Kyle is attempting to open the bottle to free the animal. Kyle struggle hard and opens it, causing the bottle to go overboard. Leo And Katie looks back and realize the bottle isnt there. Suddenly, Ranger Rocky appear with the bottle, advising them not to litter. Kyle explains himself that he wasnt littering, but was freeing the animal. They see that the animal isnt inside the bottle anymore. The Junior Rangers lost the animal, which Ranger Rocky thinks its a good time to call for Ranger Joey with some valuable information.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: As Zari scoops up water into her bucket to fill onto her sandcastles moat, she accidentally picks up a lost clown fish in the process. Back in the garden, Leo and Katie are playing a try not to laugh challenge, where the opposing side try to make the other person laugh with bad jokes. Katie laughs at a scene of Hero being goofy, which Leo counts as him winning. Leo then receives a call from Zari, informing him of the animal she discovers. After Katie and Leo learn more about the animal on Katies computer, they agree to meet up with Zari to return it to its habitat. Once in the ocean, they try swimming with it and let it go free, but this attracts the attention of a stingray. Leo saves the clownfish and put it back inside the bucket. They then meet up with Ranger Rocky, where they share their issue with the situation. Ranger Rocky calls up Ranger Joey, the ranger with the helpful information. After Ranger Joey debrief them of helpful info, Ranger Rocky excuse himself away as he has to deal with a school of dolphin. The Junior Rangers then finally found the sea anemone and returns the clownfish to its home. The day is safe and they return home. Back in the garden, Katie manages to make Leo laughs with a joke she comes up with.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Loupiote the dog is feeling particularly playful this morning! She grabs T’choupi’s stuffed and runs off to bury it in a secret location! T’choupi manages to get his plush bear back… but its fur is covered in mud! Dad washes it… but now it’s all wet and will never be dry by tonight! Tchoupi feels down: how will he be able to sleep without his precious teddy bear?! He sets off on a quest to find a replacement… but comes back empty-handed. Nina thinks she just may have a solution: what if she were to teach him how to get to sleep… “Teddy-less?...!”

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: T’choupi and Luce are awe - struck when they find out that Ciboulette the cat has just had kittens! Dad asks them to leave the babies alone as they need peace and quiet in order to grow. But the two friends go to see Ciboulette and her adorable kittens over and over, behind Dad’s back. Until… all the cats go missing!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Inspired by Nina and her father, who are preparing a delicious dessert with yummy blackberries from the woods, Tchoupi wants to make his own recipe from a forest ingredient. Easier said than done: chestnuts or mushrooms aren’t always easy to find… especially when there’s a greedy squirrel roaming nearby!

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Today is a big sports day at school with everyone running and jumping around! By the time lunch rolls around, little stomachs are growling! But the pupils’ expectations are completely shot down when they have a look at the menu… which is the worst they have ever laid eyes on!...

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam and Julia discover in their secret hideout an old comforter that probably belonged once to a child from the Mouse Mansion. Who, among the inhabitants, loose this cuddly toy in his childhood?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Uncle Ramstout stored boxes in Sam and Julias secret lair. To avoid being invaded and lose their privacy, they must find a way to clear out his workshop in order to make room for those boxes.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Sam And Julia

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: A little railway show comes to Sodor and a misunderstanding leads to all the small engines on railway turning up at Ulfstead Castle to participate.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: In Brazil, Thomas meets two wood-burning engines whove never travelled beyond their eucalyptus railway. Thomas agrees to swap jobs with them for the day, but this causes more trouble than he expects.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: After seeing him help Rosie with her toy, Mommy refers to Caillou as a "Kindness Superhero" which sends his imagination into overdrive. For the rest of the day "Super Caillou" and his sidekick "Super Gilbert" save an imaginary beach from Sharks and sunburn, whilst also making everyone in the real worlds day in the garden a little nicer, too.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: Caillou and his scout troop have been challenged to receive theirkindness badge this week! To do so, they must be kind to someone intheir community, look for acts of kindness in their lives, and, mostimportantly, be kind to themselves. Caillou is determined to finish histasks before Clementine!

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Mr. Rabbit makes up coupons for free cookies to celebrate the grand opening of his cookie shop and gives them to his young son to drop in the mailbox outside. But the coupons never arrive. After chasing down the clues from the mail carrier to the post office and back again, Huckle determines that Jr Rabbit mistakenly dropped the coupons into the trash container beside the mail box. /A model boat is mysteriously broken and Huckle, Lowly and Sally set out to discover how it happened.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey and Parrot are rehearsing for a talent show... a synchronized dance number... but of course they are anything but... Mole then appears and tells them of how Swans are known for their graceful couples dance. They decide to go to the lake and learn from the masters. When they arrive they are dazzled by swans dual dance and invite them to play Monkey See Monkey Do!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Norman and Hannah are organizing a pool party for Peter, but Mike drops some decorations onto a lantern, and soon the rescue team needs to be called.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: The bream has gone missing from the fish counter at the Wholefish Cafe, and Detective James is determined to crack The Case of the Missing Fish.

programme.title: Franklin And Friends
programme.desc: Franklin wants to play exactly the same acorn obstacle course game that he and Bear played at last year’s picnic, but Bear would rather look for bugs with his new bug identifier book. Franklin is upset his plan is ruined – until he realizes it’s okay if the picnic is not exactly the same as last year’s. They look for bugs and do the obstacle course - and have a blast! / Franklin borrows Dad’s lucky pen - without asking permission first – to help the Super Cluepers solve their latest case: Franklin’s missing baseball cap. But when the culprit turns out to be Harriet who took the cap to be more like her big brother, Franklin learns, firsthand, the importance of asking permission when you want to borrow something.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Edmond lives happily with his three little badger cubs in their underground sett. One day, he falls in love with Marguerite, a fox! Marguerite and her daughter move into the family home, turning life upside-down for everyone, who now needs to find a new way to live together in harmony.Directed by: Florian Ferrier (France, 2018)

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: What doesnt have feathers and can fly silently like a bird? Doodleboo explains how to draw a ladybug.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: How to travel all around the world ? Doodleboo explains how to draw a flying saucer.

programme.title: Doodleboo
programme.desc: Who does not mind the rain? Doodleboo explains how to draw a snail.

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff and Dave both want to be Tweet’s best friend, but Tweet can’t choose between them. So Hatty takes them all on a Friends Adventure to help Tweet decide. Helping feuding friends, Danny Duck and Penny Hen to be good friends again, by showing them how to take it in turns and share, they soon realise it is possible to have more than one best friend. And they all agree that Hatty is everyone’s best friend!

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave deliver a very big box to Speedy Sheep. When Speedy opens the box to finds her gift inside, they discover another smaller box inside with a label on it. And inside that smaller box is another gift, and another even smaller box! The Delivery Crew look carefully at the labels on the parcels to work out who they are for and find the best way to deliver them.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Spring is coming and Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse are very brave and go on a journey through the meadow to discover the source of a mysterious – and slightly spooky - creaking sound. They follow the clues to discover… it’s the frozen lake melting, and singing as it does!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse pick lots of delicious strawberries. Little Nutbrown Hare eats all his and runs out so Little Field Mouse shares hers with him. When he goes to collect some more for his friend he eats them all too. Little Field Mouse shows him how to eat them really slowly to make them last longer.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare makes a slippery slide from a pile of snow and has so much fun he decides to keep it a secret and play with it all by himself. But he soon gets bored playing by himself, and invites his friends to play. They build bigger and curvier slides together and slide faster and faster. Little Nutbrown Hare learns it’s lots more fun to shares the joy with his friends.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: In the absence of a real plaster, Bing makes one out of sticky tape, but it’s so sticky that it hurts when he tries to take it off.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing loves Arlo the cat. They are friends. Bing strokes the kitty and they play hide and seek, but what happens when Bing meets a cat that isnt as friendly?

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Flop find a patch of fluffy dandelions and blow all but one. Bing takes the last one to give to Sula but when she hugs him to say hello, the dandelion blows away.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is vooshing with Hoppity around the garden, making him fly higher and higher. With one particularly enthusiastic throw Hoppity disappears. After a hunt, Bing finds Hoppity in the washing up bowl and gets upset because a wet, mucky Hoppity just doesn’t feel right.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and his friends play Nature Explorers in Ammas garden by spinning a giant colour wheel and then finding something of that colour in the garden.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The inhabitants of the forest hold a baking contest to celebrate the arrival of summer, but Dr Owl goes overboard with tasting. With the help of Beetle Bodobács, they manage to save the evening with chimney cakes and dancing. The next day, Dr Owl apologizes and improves his mood with a group workout.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On a rainy day, Dollys house gets flooded. When the rain stops, Stanley, the stag beetle, repairs the roof. Berry also helps Dolly, who is upset about her soaked drawings. Berry visits Raymond, the copper beetle, who has plenty of bells. He asks for two special bells to cheer Dolly up. At home, he makes coconut balls and later delivers them to Dolly along with the bells, which make her very happy. Later, Berry paints over the stain caused by the rain, and Dolly repaints the pictures with the help of Flutter and Leapy. The bells bring joy to the house.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Flutter, the butterfly girl, catches a cold on a gloomy, rainy day. Doctor Owl examines her and advises her to rest a lot in bed. Her friends visit often to take care of her, and Flutter always asks them to read from her new book. Soon, everyone knows the story, which tells of a ball held in a splendid castle. One day, Balthazar makes Flutter sad by saying that the princess story is just a fairy tale. Flutter turns away, disappointed, and falls asleep. Balthazar meets Doctor Owl, who notices that something is bothering him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Mama Owls chicks are born, and soon they are strong enough for Berry and Dolly to visit them. Doctor Owl asks for their help while he works. The owl babies are very lively, and Berry and Dolly play with them enthusiastically and patiently. At lunchtime, Mama Owl is running out of patience, but eventually, they manage to feed the chicks. After finishing lunch and resting a little, the little ones regain their energy. They happily jump around Mama Owl, who feels it is time that the chicks learn to fly.

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: The kids awesome sandcastle gets trampled overnight. A lone set of footprints along the beach leads to a prime suspect who claims not to have seen their sandcastle, yet hes carrying a big shell that once adorned it. As it turns out, no one touched their castle. The culprit was the rising waters of high tide. / /Huckle, Sally and Lowly discover the impossible – a set of ski tracks that run on either side of a tall tree.

programme.title: Monkey See Monkey Do
programme.desc: Monkey and parrot are playing hide and seek, Monkey is boasting of his great hiding skills when in fact Parrot finds him each time. Mole suggests going to Chameleon who is known as the hiding expert.... They are off to the forest to find the chameleon. Chameleon gives them some hiding tips and joins them in a fun game of Monkey See Monkey Do!!!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When James tries to win the star globe in a Star Spotter competition, he ends up breaking the globe and falls into the water chasing it. Sam, Penny and the team launch an ocean rescue, after a long day of entertaining Miss Pawdrey with mouse impressions!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Hannah starts a scarecrow business, but there is one brave little bird that just isnt scared of her scarecrows.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: It’s Arnold’s birthday and he’s got some great presents. Pig has given him a cassette player – but the tape is missing. They want to play musical chairs – who has the tape? Everyone thinks everyone else has it until Tiger asks some searching questions. And the tape is in Tiger’s…. well, that would be telling wouldn’t it?

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper thinks the Wonder Dog books are great and decides to be Kipper the Super Dog. His blanket becomes a cape and his bike a Super Bike. Now he needs someone to rescue. He makes Arnold’s kite fly when there’s no wind. But he becomes a real hero when he saves Jake’s kitten. Tiger wants to be a hero too. Pig asks him to rescue Arnold’s kite – it’s stuck in a tree – but Tiger’s not so sure when he sees how tall the tree is.

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: This lunchtime, T’choupi refuses to eat the fish Dad has cooked, supposedly because it doesn’t look tasty. But Mom insists: T’choupi can’t say he doesn’t like it if he hasn’t even tried it! So, when his parents aren’t looking, T’choupi slips his piece of fish to Ciboulette the cat, who just happens to be passing by at that moment. There we are – no-one’s any the wiser, mumbles T’choupi with a sigh of relief. But when, a short time later, he notices poor little Ciboulette has a strange cough, he gets worried: did the fish he gave her to eat give her a stomach ache??!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Nina finds T’choupi’s baby sister Fanni so cute that she suggests they go out and find other "babies," in the hamlet. Launching a "baby quest," she and T’choupi come across a chick, a baby rabbit, a caterpillar and a little snail! Next, they head to the woods to find more babies. But T’choupi suddenly gapes as he spots the cutest young animal of them all: a baby hedgehog, also known as a "hoglet."

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia pretended to Sam she can do real magic. To prove him so, Julia has to find a way to do that. She will have to find different tricks to let her friend believe she really is a magician.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: A butterfly has entered the hall and cant find a way out. Sam and Julia use different strategies to capture the insect and get it back to freedom. But the butterfly doesnt seems to understand.

programme.title: Tilda Appleseed
programme.desc: Tilda and Rupert are on a boat trip when they suddenly find themselves stranded on dry land. Where has the water gone? They meet Berta, the beaver girl, and discover her dam is the cause.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets have a new idea on their mind, they want to be exactly the same and in that purpose, they wear masks at breakfast to trick Mommy. Their attempt is completely useless because, as Mommy says, "theyre a lot different from each other". The Triplets dont agree and they want her to start dressing them identically. Mommy refuses, she doesnt want robots as children. But when they meet other Triplets in the park that day, they finally realize its not so bad to be different.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: At the end of a day without arguing, the Triplets dont want to go to bed because they want to stay together, even at night ! Poet has an idea, they should meet in dreamland and then share the same dream together. Turbulent and Girl think its a wonderful idea and follow Poet in his game. But the problem is, when they arrive at Dreamland, none of them wish to do the same dream. Poet wants a dream with polar bears and lots of hugs, Turbulent wants to live on a deserted island and Girl wishes to take care of little babies...

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: When foxes lose a canine milk-tooth, there is a little initiation ritual - the hunt for the little slug. Berry is delighted to show that she is big now but her brothers are rather jealous that they were not initiated when they were little. Edmund is very worried and wonders if it is really necessary that his little sweetheart takes some risks…

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: When Caillous Scout Troop arrive for their first outdoor adventure, he finds himself a little worried of spending the night in a tent, because he is afraid of the dark! However, he soon learns that Clementine is also scared - of bugs! Everyone is afraid of something, and together they just might find a way to conquer both their fears.

programme.title: Caillou’s New Adventures
programme.desc: After ignoring Daddys words of caution, Caillou climbs a tree,breaking a branch and unknowingly hurting Gilbert. Caillou learnsto be more considerate of others needs as he helps nurse Gilbertback to full health.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Sidney is a very hard working diesel, but he’s also very forgetful. One day The Fat Controller gives him a very special job – Sidney needs to go to Brendam Docks to collect Percy’s new wheels. But when Sidney admits that he’s worried he might forget what he has to do, Thomas suggests making up a little song to help him remember. Sidney goes off happily singing a song about collecting a crate from Brendam docks, but when he stops to talk to Gordon he gets distracted, forgets what he’s supposed to be doing, and ends up at The Waste Dump looking for boilers then The Animal Park waiting for an elephant!

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: The trainees are going off to training camp to learn to work as a team and acquire new skills. They have to put up three shelters before sunset, when Skylar and Tyne will come to inspect them. Things get off to a bumpy start when Hoot and Toot squabble over who is taking which cars. They accidentally leave one behind with half the parts for the shelters. Its not long before Brewster notices that they don’t have everything they need. Hoot and Toot feel terrible for letting the team down.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Lots of freight has arrived from the docks and Cormac is worried how he and Old Puffer Pete will get it all delivered in time. He hopes Pete has his fast wheels on today. Pete says that he doesn’t, because slow and steady is the way to go. Cormac disagrees and challenges Pete to a race. They will divide up all the deliveries and the first to finish wins.

programme.title: Charley Goes To School
programme.desc: Today is a big sports day at school with everyone running and jumping around! By the time lunch rolls around, little stomachs are growling! But the pupils’ expectations are completely shot down when they have a look at the menu… which is the worst they have ever laid eyes on!...

programme.title: Ruff Ruff, Tweet And Dave
programme.desc: Ruff-Ruff, Tweet and Dave go exploring, following clues which lead them to discover a strange new animal - a doggy-birdy-panda that’s a mixture of all three of them put together!

programme.title: Charley Loves Nature
programme.desc: Ciboulette the cat has stolen Fanni’s plush toy, making the little girl extremely sad. T’choupi and Nina are determined to get the toy back but the cat refuses to comply! After several vain attempts at approaching Ciboulette, the two friends receive unexpected assistance… from the chickens!.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kai testing his new Kaizer upgrade, which detects sounds from afar. He picks up the sound of gushing water and a snow leopards yowl, leading him to investigate further. Back in the garden, Leo and Katie are playing a rescue mission game, communicate through their communication devices and pretend to find clues related to a lost hiker. They discover tracks and eventually locate the lost hiker, who is represented by a stuffed toy. They realize they need transportation to rescue the hiker and use Hero, the dog, as their "rescue transportation." The game was cut short as Leo receives a call from Kai on the animal he discover, which was revealed to be a snow leopard and is in trouble. The Junior Rangers agrees to help and meet up with Kai at his location. The Junior Rangers arrive in the mountains of Nepal. Kai struggles to pinpoint the exact location of the Snow Leopard due to the echo caused by the mountains. Hero uses his sense of smell and finds faint Snow Leopard paw prints, leading the group in the right direction. While following the paw prints, they encounter difficulties due to fresh snow covering the tracks. Leo uses binoculars to search for the well-camouflaged Snow Leopard.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: On Reggie Squirrel’s seventh birthday, he couldnt find his friends at home. He runs into Harry Hedgehog, who offers to take him for a ride in a carriage. When they return, the forest inhabitants celebrate Reggie Squirrel together, giving him seven candles as a gift. They then fly in a hot air balloon, marveling at the night sky. Finally, Reggie Squirrel happily returns home and wishes his friends a good night.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: Bubble and Stanley gather chestnuts, and then they create marvelous figures out of them at the house of the stag beetle. Bubble takes the figures home, but upon seeing the mess, Stanley offers his help. In the process, they get caught up in a series of accidents, resulting in the gingerbread house breaking. Bubble receives a new gingerbread house from Rosita the rose beetle and happily tidies up his room.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly
programme.desc: The green Grub wants to stay with Dolly for the winter, but always finds her at the wrong time with the request. The Wind accidentally blows the The Green Grub to the seaside, then brings it back to Dolly. Finally, Dolly happily welcomes the Green Grub for the winter and prepares a comfortable bed for him.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly 05 Mepe
programme.desc: Berry the snail and Dolly the ladybird are the best friends ever. They have many adventures, while they make new friends and get knowledge about the world around them.

programme.title: Berry And Dolly

With the help of Beetle Bodobács, they manage to save the evening with chimney cakes and dancing. The next day, Dr Owl apologizes and improves his mood with a group workout.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is sad when his new orange balloon pops so Flop helps him make a Bye Bye Box, a memory box for broken toys too special to throw away.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Pando play on the swings together but when Pando takes longer than his turn, Bing gets angry and runs infront of the swings and gets bumped.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing is building a tower of blocks when Coco takes some to make a rainbow. When Charlie wants to play with the blocks too, they decide to make a new game they can all play.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: If youre very quiet and statue still, then the duckies will come. Today, Bing and Sula are at the park to feed the ducks. Sula is very good at standing still like a statue and only giving a small handful of food to the ducks when they come up to her. Bing, on the other hand, throws all the food into the water at once – not thinking that a big quacking goose will come along and eat it all in one bite!

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Its snack time for Bing so Flop suggests they make a smoothie. When Bings carrot accidentally gets put in the blender, hes upset to disover he cant have it back.

programme.title: Bing Bunny - Shorts and characters

programme.title: Simon
programme.desc: Simon is playing football with Mamalou and Ferdinand when he slips on the ball. Embarrassed by his mistake, Simon blames Ferdinand and tells him that theyre not friends any more.

programme.title: The Fox-Badger Family
programme.desc: Woodsy is desperately trying to do do something that requires calm and concentration but his intrusive family make it impossible. The more he tries to be on his own, the less the others leave him alone as they are very curious to find out what he is up to…

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare has a new game. He will be Big Nutbrown Hare for a day, doing jobs like finding food, answering tricky questions and resting in the grass. Likewise, Big Nutbrown Hare must take on his son’s jobs of playing with his friends, making up new games and asking questions. It’s all great fun until they realize that they are much, much better at being themselves.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: A Summer storm sweeps across the valley and a nervous Little Nutbrown Hare and his friends scamper into a cave with Big Nutbrown Hare. They are all safe and dry in the cave, but the thunder outside is still scary. Big Nutbrown Hare explains that noises can’t hurt you… but will he help them overcome their fears enough to enjoy the storm and the wonders of nature that it brings?

programme.title: Boribon
programme.desc: Boribon receives seven balloons of different colours as a gift from Annalee. However, soon all of them disappear, and Boribon is left with none. Boribon feels sad. In the end, although the balloons are gone, the seven colours shine in the rainbow.

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Julia and Sam must babysit Ben. A game of hide and seek is launched in the residence. But Sams little brother is so well hidden that he cant be found. Where could he be hiding?

programme.title: Sam And Julia
programme.desc: Friends Day: Sam overhears Julia talking to her best friend. He thought it was him?! Worried, Sam decides to investigate. (S1, ep 3)

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: The Triplets each receive surprise packages with little instruments, but Poet and Turbulent are quite jealous of Girl’s pretty trumpet. "No wonder we werent lucky, its Friday the 13th". But the little girl explains that luck is all about what state of mind you are in. She tells them the story of Allpink and Allgrey, a little boy who believed Friday the 13th was a lucky day and another one who thought it only brought bad luck.

programme.title: The Triplets
programme.desc: When Grandpa discovers tons of holes in his garden he immediately suspects Toto, who happens to be covered in mud. But the Triplets find many excuses to protect their little dog. They really have to find a solution to help him lose this bad habit and are convinced that he needs to keep busy. It would be easier if Toto were not so lazy! However, when Grandpas back akes too much to dig holes and plant seeds, Toto saves the day.

programme.title: Chuggington
programme.desc: Speed Fleet, Chug Patrol and the Chuggineers are competing in the Track Dash fun race. The team that has all its members cross the finish line first wins. Koko is sure Speed Fleet will win, until Hanzo breaks down and can’t move! Brewster and Wilson offer to help, but Koko tells them they may as well finish the race; there’s no way Speed Fleet can win now. They refuse. Koko needs them more than their teams do. They’re Team Trainee! Using the Mega Crane, Brewster and Wilson transport Hanzo across the finish line.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When James tries to win the star globe in a Star Spotter competition, he ends up breaking the globe and falls into the water chasing it. Sam, Penny and the team launch an ocean rescue, after a long day of entertaining Miss Pawdrey with mouse impressions!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Hannah starts a scarecrow business, but there is one brave little bird that just isnt scared of her scarecrows.

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Kipper, Pig and Arnold enjoy themselves riding on the Big Wheel and looking in distorting mirrors at the Fair. They decide to go into the maze and Pig worries about Arnold getting lost. Guess who gets lost? It isn’t Arnold!

programme.title: Kipper
programme.desc: Big Owl gets dirty and Kipper decides to give him a bath. Tiger’s hat falls in the mud and they decide to give it a bath too. Things get totally out of hand and they wash blankets, all the other toys and finally themselves.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: Caillou and his classmates face a tough decision when their soccer ball rolls out of bounds. They consider breaking Ms. Martin’s rules to retrieve it until Caillou imagines he’s a space captain who flies his ship through a black hole and discovers that rules are often made for good reasons.

programme.title: Caillou (new 3D) Mepe
programme.desc: Caillou proudly shows off a new scooter trick to his friends, but when they grow tired of his bragging they pretend to be Rodeo Stars like Buck Buckaroo (Caillou) who is discouraged by Lizzy Lasso’s (Clementine) bragging. Lizzy, and Caillou, learn that showing off can sometimes make others feel bad.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Nia uses what she learns about lighthouses to suggest covering a big wheel in Christmas lights, so Harold can see where he is going in a storm

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Zari is skating her way through the park in an urgent hurry to find a bathroom. She finally spots a public toilet and dashes in. After she finished her business, she encounter a green peacock with its tail feathers open, admiring itself in the mirror. The creature is blocking the way out of the toilet. Back in the garden. Leo and Katie are playing with a large hand mirror where Leo draws on it to make the the person seeing themselves to have bunny whiskers. They play around with Hero, their dog. Then Leo receives a call from Zari, informing of her being trapped by the green peacock. After learning more information on the animal back in their treehouse, the Junior Rangers agree in helping Zari escapes there by travelling to save her. Once they arrive, Leo has an idea of using the large hand mirror to bait the peacock out of the public toilet. His plan work, but now the peacock is attempting to chases him over. Leo evades the animals pounce when Ranger Rocky grab him above to saves him.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: Kyle arrives at the beach on his ATV only to be disappointed by the sight of scattered trash. Reluctantly, he cleans up the mess while venting his frustration at the unknown culprit. As he heads back to his ATV, he encounters a curious raccoon but fails to get close to it as it scampers away at the sound of the trash bag. Curiosity gets the better of Kyle, leading him to investigate underneath his ATV. To his surprise, he discovers a partially buried nest of eggs. Meanwhile, in the garden, Leo and Katie prepare a bath for their beloved dog Hero. Much to their astonishment, Hero returns with a duckling in tow, leaving everyone perplexed. The duckling jumps into the bath, enjoying itself, and Hero finds himself torn between joining in or not. Amidst the confusion, Leo receives a call from Kyle, who informs him about the raccoon that laid the eggs. Skeptical at first, the Junior Rangers decide to gather more information using Katies computer. Convinced of the situations authenticity, they agree to meet up with Kyle to help him move his stuck ATV without disturbing the eggs. They strategize and come up with a plan to lift the ATV using it like a helicopter. Their efforts pay off, but as the eggs start to hatch, they notice the baby turtles heading in the wrong direction away from the ocean. Kyle attempts to intervene but is stopped by the arrival of Ranger Rocky, who emerges from the sea.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Pat has to deliver a hibernation box to Amy for Dora the Doormouse. Meanwhile the children are looking for a clubhouse for their superhero club. Pat collects the shed from the Sorting Office and uses his helicopter for the delivery but disaster strikes when the shed lands in a tree! When it turns out the shed is not what Amy had ordered, Pat saves the day by making a special home for Dora with cardboard boxes and the shed becomes a special treehouse for the superhero club.

programme.title: Postman Pat Special Delivery Service
programme.desc: Baby Nik has lost his green rabbit and cannot sleep without it.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Flop teaches Bing and Pando how to blow bubbles. Bing finally blows a big bubble but gets upset when Pando pops it.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula head off for a picnic at the paddling pool with Flop. But when they get there, they are shocked to find there is no water inside. Bing’s disappointment soon gives way to the realisation that it’s a very special pool day. With no water there are all sorts of games they can play that are usually against the pool rules.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: During Bing’s bedtime routine he inadvertently pees on his blankie and it’s too wet to wash and dry before bed. Fortunately his Hoppity Voosh toy has a cape just as soft and huggy as blankie and it even smells just right too.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Coco shows Bing how to do really good Big Boos and together they make Flop jump. When Bing tries out his new tricks on Charlie he finds out the power of Boo has to be scaled down for babies.

programme.title: Bing Bunny
programme.desc: Bing and Sula discover a new toy at Amma’s crèche, a talking ride on car. It seems like fun until Talkie Taxi keeps saying the same thing over and over again. When the taxi crashes and is finally silenced Bing and Sula use their imagination to play a game they really want to play without being dictated to by the noisy taxi.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald is excited to meet Henrys cousin, Louie, but as the penguins catch up on old times, Oswald feels left out. Convinced they don’t want him around, Oswald goes home. The penguins suddenly notice Oswald is missing and seek him out. Henry tells Louie what a great friend Oswald is. Happy again, Oswald plays the piano as Henry and Louie dance the Penguin Polka together.

programme.title: Oswald
programme.desc: Oswald decides to grow tomatoes in his back garden, so he and Weenie go to Bingos Bazaar to buy a tomato plant. Once planted, it quickly produces a juicy red tomato, but the next morning the fruit is half-eaten by a snail. Oswald and Weenie plant other tomato plants and the vines produce lots of tomatoes, but overnight they are eaten by snails. Frustrated, Oswald moves the plants into the house, but he soon worries that the snails may be hungry. He leaves half the plants in the garden for the snails and grows the rest on the windowsill for him and Weenie!

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: When Skye Sampson asks Bob and Team to create a beach motocross course on Fixham Beach, Bob is so enthused he decides to compete himself. But it’s been a while since he’s ridden his old bike and he wonders if it will even make it round the course. While Bob and Curtis work on the bike, word gets out that there is a mysterious entrant called the Masked Biker. Scoop and Muck become convinced that the Masked Biker is Leo, hiding his identity to take part even though he isn’t old enough to race.

programme.title: Bob the Builder
programme.desc: Mr Bentley is doing vocal warm-ups with the Spring City Rockets, and is about to begin rehearsals for his latest masterpiece, “A Pocketful of Pirates”. As Bob, Wendy, Leo, Dizzy and Muck arrive to renovate the hilltop theatre, Mr Bentley encourages them to join in the warm-ups. But Bob proves to be a hopeless thespian. As he confesses: I’m a builder, not a actor!” But Dizzy shows theatrical flair. When Mr Bentley has to run home and retrieve an important prop, he asks Dizzy to assistant direct. She’s so excited by the task that she accidentally tells Leo to use slow-drying cement instead of fast-drying cement as they begin paving a hillside track down to the theatre. Torn between two important tasks - the play and the build - Dizzy also messes up her directorial duties, telling Brandon to get his pirate props from the wrong box.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare wakes early one Summer morning before the sun has risen. Big Nutbrown Hare sends Little Nutbrown Hare off to invite his friends for breakfast so he can rest a little longer. Along the way Little Nutbrown Hare discovers how wonderful and different all his friends homes are. Will Little Nutbrown Hare still love his own home as much as he did?

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: The series follows a warm father-son relationship that Little Nutbrown Hare decides he wants a clever long tail like his friends, rather than a short fluffy one. They help out by making him a long tail but all the results are either too tickly, bendy or flappy. When Big Nutbrown Hare spots his son from way across a grassy field everyone realizes that Little Nutbrown Hare’s little tail is clever in its own way.

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: One Summer’s day Little Field Mouse is very excited to show Little Nutbrown Hare her new favourite thing, a very pretty flower… the prettiest ever! She lets Little Nutbrown Hare borrow it to show Big Nutbrown Hare, but when it blows away during the night Little Nutbrown Hare worries how his friend will react. Will he be able to work up the courage to tell her what happened?

programme.title: Learning Time With Timmy
programme.desc: It’s Art Time and Timmy is painting a picture of a rainbow. What colours are in the rainbow?

programme.title: Hurray for Huckle!
programme.desc: Baby Sadies dolly has mysteriously gone missing somewhere between home and the band shell in Busytown Park. Huckle and his team search for clues at all the places Sadie visited that day. They discover the dolly inside a grand piano thats playing a few sour notes./Cars are disappearing from a particular parking space, Huckle and gang set out to find out why.

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Messy goes to Okido to find out why vacuum cleaners are so noisy, and inadvertantly releases a huge swarm of Vacubot 2000s across Okido City!

programme.title: Messy Goes to Okido
programme.desc: Messy wants to run further, but he keeps getting out of breath. Will he able to take on the Great Okido Challenge, and race to the finish line?

programme.title: Strawberry Shortcakes Berry Bitty Adventures
programme.desc: With the power still out in Berry Bitty City, the girls go on an overnight camping trip. Lemon worries that a creepy creature is in the forest, and the girls get the nervous bug. Strawberry turns their apprehension into fun by daring her friends to stay out in the woods the longest! But soon, someone steals their marshmallow roasting sticks, the capture-the-flag-flags and the horseshoes. Lemon is sure that someone’s out to sabotage the campout! The girls build wacky monster-traps and capture... Huckleberry, who had gotten himself lost in the dark woods.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry isnt allowed to join Sams band because hes not very good at playing the drums.

programme.title: Harry And His Bucket Full Of Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Harry wants to build a dream house and realises he must go to Dino-World in order to find the space and materials to build.

programme.title: Leo the Wildlife Ranger
programme.desc: A swim in the garden brings Leo and Hero up close and personal with a Malayan water monitor. The Junior Rangers set out to search for the monitor’s home, but will their jeep survive a river crossing after a jeep float gets punctured?

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Thomas loves to race against Max and Monty, the cheeky dumper trucks. But, after one near accident too many, he decides he must ignore them if he wants to get on and be Useful. But, without Thomas to race against, Max and Monty muck about at the building site and Oliver is damaged. Then they race against the other construction vehicles, to see who can get their work done quickest. Rather than driving all the way to the dump, Max and Monty chuck all their building debris over a wall… not realising that the rubble is blocking Thomas’s branch line! When Thomas returns with Oliver, he ploughs into the pile of dirt and rocks and is derailed. So Max and Monty have to stay up all night clearing the line!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends
programme.desc: Connor is one of the fastest engines that visits the Island of Sodor, and is proud that he is always bang on time! But one day one of his coupling rods breaks and nearly derails him. Connor is shocked. He’s never broken down before and decides that he must have been going too fast. Even after he is fully repaired he is too worried to go fast and travels so slow that Thomas overtakes him pulling the local. Thomas wants to help his friend, but it is Stephen who finally convinces Connor that he really does want to go fast again.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Sandro and Stella are preparing a surprise party for Davids tenth anniversary as captain of the fire brigade. But Fume unwittingly smashes the cake Sandro baked, and the firefighter doesnt have time to make a new one because he has to go on a rescue mission. So Grisu offers to bake one in his stead, helped by Stella. They immediately run into difficulties as the grocery shop is closed. They have to get their ingredients elsewhere – Fume at Gertrudes, Stella at Marias pizzeria and Grisu at Guellecs farm. This entails comic mishaps such as Stella running on a rollin pin or Grisu pursued by the black sheep.

programme.title: Grisu
programme.desc: Natureza is going to to the polar cap to conduct some studies. She needs someone to build an igloo for her while she sets up scientific instruments. Impervious to cold, Grisu accepts to come along and build the igloo. He quickly runs into comic difficulties: the snow he is to dig out to make bricks gets too hard, hes distracted by a playful sea lion, then hes trapped by falling icicles (and fortunately gets rescued by Natureza)… To top it off, as Grisu is almost done, a snowball thrown by the sea lion smashes on his head. Surprised, the little dragon lets out a flame that melts down the igloos top. But a firefighter never gives up!

programme.title: Guess How Much I Love You
programme.desc: Little Nutbrown Hare and Little Field Mouse pick lots of delicious strawberries. Little Nutbrown Hare eats all his and runs out so Little Field Mouse shares hers with him. When he goes to collect some more for his friend he eats them all too. Little Field Mouse shows him how to eat them really slowly to make them last longer.

programme.title: Rivalites musicales - Furtwangler contre Toscanini
programme.desc: Two men without whom the profession of conductor would not be what it is today. Two men who couldnt be more different from each other: Arturo Toscanini and Wilhelm Furtwangler. The former was rigorously faithful to the musical score, the latter conducted with radical subjectivity. In 1931 they both conducted at the Bayreuth Festival – for the first and last time. Soon the polite rivalry turned into bitter enmity. Both men were forced to take a stand on the regimes in their respective countries – and chose radically different paths. Toscanini, "the dictator", bravely challenged Mussolini; Furtwangler, a conservative, meanwhile proclaimed that art is always apolitical and reluctantly made a pact with the Nazis. The documentary not only opens up the different musical universes of the two great conductors by retracing their careers in Milan, Bayreuth and New York, but also raises a question that is more topical than ever: what has art to do with politics?Subtitles available for this program with your remote control
